name: Store Thirty3
description: Store Thirty3 prides itself on being an ever-changing, inspirational boutique full of beautiful homeware and lifestyle products with a distinctly Scandinavian feel. Their range includes designer homeware from brands like House Doctor and Bloomingville, luxury clothing from brands including Saint Tropez, Soaked In Luxury and Coster Copenhagen, stunning jewellery and a collection of bags and accessories.

founder_quote: "Our mission at Maiden is simple: to make fun, quality gifts accessible to everyone."
description: First established in 2009 by Noah Crutchfield, Maiden has become a legendary fixture in Shoreditch's creative independent community. Noah's empire has since expanded to two wonderful shops at Boxpark Shoreditch; THE GIFT BOX & THE PLAY BOX both stocking the different and ever updated bright, eclectic range of gifts that Maiden has become renowned for. A destination for those seeking an original gift, Maiden also plays host to design-led homewares with a humorous twist.
name: MAIDEN

description: Of Cabbages & Kings is not only a shop and gallery, but also a creative space and communal hub for art and design in North East London. Working with aspiring homegrown talent alongside established UK artists and designers, the shop stocks a handpicked selection of jewellery stationery and homewares, while the gallery specialises in limited edition prints. With an ethos of nurturing the local, we engage with artists, designers and the public through exhibitions, workshops and events.
name: Of Cabbages and Kings

description: Rouge specialises in vintage and new furniture, ceramics and decorative items for the home, many sourced directly from China. The bold colours and simple forms provide splashes of colour and texture that complement a contemporary home. Rouge is situated in the heart of independent shops, bars and restaurants of Stoke Newington, an area offering an alternative to the chain dominated high street experience of much of London.
founder_quote: Independent furniture and homeware shop ROUGE was founded in 2005 by Lei Yang. As a former fashion designer, Lei has a distinctive eye for colour, pattern and texture. Her love of the Far Eastern aesthetic is fused with a modern European look, and this informs her selection for the collections of vintage Chinese furniture, contemporary ceramic pieces and textiles found in the London shop and online store.
name: Rouge
Woven
description: Woven has a simple philosophy; that good design doesn’t have to be expensive and should be available to all irrespective of budget. As the name suggests, Woven are experts in textiles and rugs, showcasing an exceptional array of rugs from around the world alongside handpicked collection of homewares.

founder_quote:
Lewis & Co was established with a simple concept in mind…to provide affordable modern design with style and class. Every design detail has significance. Form follows function. Our philosophy is to celebrate a relaxed, urban lifestyle and embrace the way people live their everyday lives. It’s really about comfort and functionality.

Located in Marylebone, in the heart of London, we’re easily accessible and invite you to stop in for a visit.  Whether you’re looking for home furnishings and accessories, bespoke furniture or an interior design consultation, let us help you.  If you’re looking for something specific, we can either find it for you or have it commissioned.

In the shop, we carry an eclectic blend of furnishings and lighting, complemented with a variety of accessories including glassware, cushions, scented candles, framed art work, leather goods and small items perfect for any home.  All of our items are procured from European designers and manufacturers.
name: Lewis & Co.
description:
Lewis & Co was established with a simple concept in mind…to provide affordable modern design with style and class. Every design detail has significance. Form follows function. Our philosophy is to celebrate a relaxed, urban lifestyle and embrace the way people live their everyday lives. It’s really about comfort and functionality.

Located in Marylebone, in the heart of London, we’re easily accessible and invite you to stop in for a visit.  Whether you’re looking for home furnishings and accessories, bespoke furniture or an interior design consultation, let us help you.  If you’re looking for something specific, we can either find it for you or have it commissioned.

Volte Face seeks out design-led gifts, stand-out stationery, artists’ products and books. The emphasis is on interesting objects for everyday use infused with creative thought and some things we think are just fun!
name: Volte Face
founder_quote: We aim to satisfy a range of tastes and stock main brands alongside products from small independent designers and creators. Volte Face aims to be contemporary, eclectic, eccentric and exciting!

name: Indish Design Shop
founder_quote: "For us the best thing is that we get to be in control of our lives doing what we love. For our customers we hope we've curated a collection that is exciting, useful and beautiful."
description: Indish has been flying the flag for good design in Crouch End since 1996, with owners Melanie Silgardo and Kasha Dalal understanding the importance of good, useful design that lasts and has a purpose in your home. The London Design Guide said it best: 'The whole essence of this shop challenges locals to leave empty-handed.'

Started by husband and wife duo Matthew and Zoe alongside long term friend Simon, After Noah first opened it's doors in Islington in 1990. Combining vintage and restored furniture with modern design, their mission was to create a store that represented how people actually shopped for their homes; a mix of old pieces and new additions. With a unique and eclectic mix of stock, buying for the shop remains in the hands of the partners who hand pick everything from the greeting cards and spud guns to the desk lights and sofas.
founder_quote: "Why "After Noah"? It's our dateline. We stock anything we like or feel strongly about, so we say that we sell anything after Noah - no special period, just things that fit with life."
name: After Noah
Future and Found
founder_quote: "Our boutique presents our own designs alongside things we love from designers around the world. All have a design aesthetic in common, they are simple, stylish and well designed."
description: With a vision for what’s to come and a love of what’s been before, Future and Found, located in Tufnell Park, London, offers a carefully curated collection of beautiful home and lifestyle products. Having worked in retail buying and product design for 10 years, owner Andrea has a wealth of knowledge and experience which she brings to Future and Found.  A destination for design aficionados, the boutique is also the perfect spot for shoppers needing a quick caffeine fix, the spacious courtyard home to a Piaggio Ape coffee scooter.

founder_quote: "I get inspired by anyone who dares to be a bit different. Individuals who can do this without compromising the quality of their product, and still preserve their integrity are really inspiring to me."
description: Tipped by The Times as having the best selection of Scandinavian fashion in London, Wild Swans in Islington stocks a wide range of established and emerging Scandi designers selected by Danish-born owner, Caroline Van Luthje. Named after the Hans Christian Andersen fairytale 'The Wild Swans', the name perfectly describes the elegant yet edgy range of clothing and lifestyle products.
name: Wild Swans Islington
HAYGEN
founder_quote: "I'm inspired by strong female entrepreneurs, running a business can be really tough at times and you need a thick skin and determination to fight through difficult times."
description: Founded in London in 2011 by Irish born Jenny Hughes, HAYGEN in Islington has grown into a one-of-a-kind destination lifestyle store for those seeking a unique mix of beautiful home furnishings, gifts and accessories. Coming from a long legacy of entrepreneurs, Jenny studied business at university before doing a brief stint in the corporate world. She quickly became frustrated at the lack of creativity and quit to pursue her dream of opening her own boutique.

name: Hexagone
description:
Hexagone is a French lifestyle concept store located by Camden Passage in Islington.

Named after the geometrical shape of the country, Hexagone was born out of a desire to create an inventory of iconic French brands that have survived the passage of time as well as a handpicked selection of products that celebrate the country’s design, heritage and craftsmanship.
founder_quote: Hexagone, based in trendy Camden Passage, offers a unique and exclusive range of products mostly manufactured by small and independent houses and sourced from all over France. The intimate and eclectic selection is displayed in six categories (like the hexagon) - home, beauty, apothecary, stationary, accessories and kids.

name: ARTHOUSE Meath
description: ARTHOUSE Meath is a social enterprise, shop and studio that showcases the skills of men and women living with complex epilepsy, learning and physical difficulties, founded by Becky Sheraidah. Over 70 artists work alongside instructors who enable groups or individuals to create artworks which are developed into beautiful products for sale. All work derives from the skills each artist brings to the enterprise and every contribution holds true value.
founder_quote: "Each person’s unique style comes with a fresh, raw, honest feel, a style which I knew mainstream artists were striving to achieve. I knew there was room for this work in the marketplace."

name: Chapter Clothing
description: Founded by Stefano in 2014, Chapter Clothing is a menswear boutique for the discerning shopper, located in the heart of Leamington Spa. The boutique offers a choice mix of well-known brands and up-and-coming designers, all with an offbeat edge. Stefano is a firm advocate of the independent lifestyle, and appreciates the ability to offer customers something they won't find in a high street chain.
founder_quote: I think independent retailers are here to stay; they always offer something different, and a more personal touch.

name: of/Berlin
description: Sick of the run-of-the-mill gifts and accessories available to shoppers in Germany's capital, friends Vesna and Catrin decided to open their own boutique, of/Berlin. The aim? To showcase the creativity of the city's talented local makers and designers, and to offer customers an alternative shopping experience. Each product that the boutique stocks has been handpicked for its ability to truly capture the city's independent spirit.
founder_quote: We are constantly inspired by Berlin, with its Mediterranean attitude and rough edges. There's just so much happening out here, it's amazing.

description: English eccentricity meets Scandinavian simplicity at Brixton Village based boutique Rose & Thorn, with owners Kamilla and Janine bringing their British and Danish style to the boutique. Discover home accessories, fashion and beautiful jewellery designed by Kamilla herself.
name: Rose & Thorn
founder_quote: We stock a varied range of interesting gifts, and we are a destination in Brixton for jewellery. Come visit us in store to see the full edit including our unique hand crafted woven wall hangings, printed dresses, baskets and rugs.

description: SNAP is a shop, opened in 2012 on East London's Roman Road, selling contemporary gifts including jewellery, prints, books, homewares, stationery, gift wrap, alongside an ever-popular range of soft toy dinosaurs. The focus is on modern products which are well-designed, bold and fun.
founder_quote: SNAP is a store selling contemporary cards, gifts and lifestyle products. The shop opened in June 2012 and is on Roman Road in the heart of East London.
name: Snap Store

founder_quote:
We work small, we work independently, and we work in the UK. Three things amongst many, which we are passionate about.
Jewellery bought from Comfort Station is jewellery made in our studio at 22 Cheshire Street. And that’s made as in, drawn, designed, built, assembled, shaped, engraved, fitted, drilled, clamped, soldered, polished, oxidised, gold-plated, pierced, pieced together, and boxed- all in our studio.
name: Comfort Station
description:
London-born Fine Artist, Amy Anderson,
began Comfort Station on Portobello Road, with
a market stall designed to delight the passer by.
Conceived as a weekend venture to fund her art
practice; the experimental little sister was an
instant success.  Gaining international buyers,
and a regular local following, its universe rapidly
expanded, and in 2003 Comfort Station
premiered at London Fashion Week.

In 2004, a destination store was born, and 22
Cheshire Street has been home to Comfort
Station ever since.  It features in fashion, design
and interior publications for its ambient styling as
well as the delicate conceptual jewelry Comfort
Station is loved for. Open books and suitcases
line the walls, elegantly displaying the collection
in a dreamlike world of suspended animation.
Each collection grows from a different theme;
science, mathematics, the phonetic alphabet,
geographical destinations, cosmology and ento-
mology add an extra coded layer of meaning to
every piece. Collectively the jewelry is edged
with an air of dark romanticism, a signature of
the brand.

Comfort Station is founded on clear ethics.
Working closely with her own studio team
and with various collaborators, Amy ensures
that each piece is manufactured in the UK.
Every collection is handcrafted at the in-house
studio to the highest finish, using materials
ranging from precious metals to sustainable
resourced wood, and re-appropriated antique
books.

Precious was opened in 2006 by Kate Evans, former fashion buyer for Harvey Nichols and Harrods.

The boutique stocks selected pieces from International luxury brands including Diane von Furstenberg, Carven, MiH Jeans, Goat, and By Malene Birger as well as collections from smaller labels like Vilagallo, Marie Sixtine and Ongenue.  The store also sells an impressive range of accessories by brands such as Liebeskind, Becksondergaard and Olivia Burton.

This destination boutique tucked away on a tiny Spitalfields side street is well worth a visit.
founder_quote: We love finding new treasures that we can share with our customers! Whether you are looking for that special piece or just topping up your everyday wardrobe, you will find something special here at Precious.
name: Precious

founder_quote: My inspiration comes from many sources - a name, a legend, an intriguing new ingredient, a place, a feeling - and I began by making interior fragrances, all strong on atmosphere!
name: Angela Flanders Perfumery, Spitalfields
description:
Angela Flanders established her original perfumery in East London, in the heart of the famous Columbia Road Flower Market, in 1985. A second store located in Spitalfields opened in 2012. Now run by her daughter, this unique perfumery has grown quietly over the years, becoming a destination for those in the know, who appreciate the art and craft of fine Artisan Perfumery.
The translation of an idea into liquid emotion attracts all who indulge in the luxury of fine handmade fragrance – perfumes which defy classification, a golden flask of joy, a drop of magic in every bottle.
The collection now includes over 35 individual and unique perfumes. From original favourites such as Mandarin and Mint, to more exotic blends like Figue Noire. Flanders was awarded a coveted FiFi Award for Best New Independent Fragrance 2012 for Precious One, an intriguing floral chypre.
The collection of home fragrances, skin care and therapeutics are still represented in the shops, they hark back to the early days, and are in effect the DNA of the heritage of this quietly iconic English brand.

name: Zoe and Morgan
founder_quote: For us, creating jewellery is our adventure. It's about the alchemy of imagination, freedom, family and love. Working with precious metals and stones that can transcend time and hold so much integrity, positive energy and happy memories.
description: Zoe & Morgan jewellery has become the choice for the style-aware, the individually minded, and those with an appreciation for the unique. Their pieces are elegantly crafted, designed to be both wearable and timeless. The founders spent their childhood watching their father make jewellery in his own workshop which ingrained in them from an early age an appreciation of the craft.

founder_quote: Diverso is a young creative brand inspired by the art and tradition of Italian craftsmanship and led by innovative British design. Using the finest fabrics and materials, completely produced in Italy – Diverso creates inventive yet wearable menswear to achieve one goal; to create something beautiful that did not exist before.
description: Diverso is a young creative brand founded in London by Darren Hampton and James Reynolds. From its simple beginnings in 2003 the brand has grown, finding constant inspiration in the luxury fabrics and handmade artisanal heritage of the 'Made in Italy' hallmark.
name: Diverso
Wandering Minds
founder_quote: Wandering Minds is a womenswear boutique set in a pop-up in the trendy Box Park in Shoreditch. Filled with up-and-coming labels from the coolest cities around the globe, the store offers cool Londoners unique yet affordable pieces.
description: Everything is limited-edition, so there are constantly new treasures to be discovered. The only place in London where you'll find labels from Berlin, Seoul, London, Tokyo, Copenhagen, Paris and Sydney under one roof.

For more than a decade Source Lifestyle has scoured Europe and beyond to bring you the latest and the best gifts available. Our collections encompass homeware and lifestyle, personal and fashion accessories and a brilliant range of fun, quirky and unusual gifts for every special occasion and to suit everyone’s pocket. Our handy gifts section is segmented into budget ranges so you can browse the whole collection for the present you want, at the price you want to pay. Gifts for him, presents for her and lovely fun gift ideas for baby – it’s so easy when you shop at Source.
name: Source
founder_quote: Source is a lifestyle boutique based in the heart of Spitalfields offering a great selection of gifts for friends and family or just for yourself!

name: Hop of Hackney
description: Hop of Hackney was founded by Derick and Rachel in 2016. Rachel's first ever job was in a toy shop so it was a feeling of nostalgia that led them to open Hop of Hackney. A store that evokes those fond memories of childhood. Hop of Hackney comes from a desire to blend the memories of being children, spending pocket money and loving all the fantastic things in a gift that comes with being a child. Alongside, fulfilling an adult’s need to source. Their aim is to source some of the world’s most talented independent artisans.
founder_quote: Hop of Hackney comes from a desire to blend the memories of being children, spending pocket money and loving all the fantastic things in a gift that comes with being a child. Alongside, fulfilling an adult’s need to source. Their aim is to source some of the world’s most talented independent artisans.
Blackbird London is a beautifully curated family owned designer boutique based in the heart of fashionable Battersea, South West London.
description: Nestled amongst the creative district in Battersea, Blackbird Jewellery specialise in custom-made jewellery, homewares and beautiful gifts. Alongside their own jewellery brand, Blackbird Jewellery, they also collaborate with some of the best British designers to create unique pieces in a range of colours and styles, there’s something for everyone.
name: Blackbird Jewellery

description: Marc Wallace launched his first collection in 2000 and has since become renowned worldwide for his handmade suits and luxury accessories; Marc’s passion to challenge the direction of menswear is evident in the label’s fresh and original style. Through Marc’s hands on approach, collaborating with skilled artisans on limited edition pieces, the label continues to drive forward with inspiration and design at its heart.
name: Marc Wallace

founder_quote: Founded in 2013 the Turpentine is run by three friends with a love for design. We're passionate about supporting young designers and brands. Everything we stock is carefully curated, creativity and quality are really important to us. We want everyone to get more creative too, so we run art workshops from our Brixton store.
description:
The Turpentine is a creative hub based in the heart of Brixton, bringing handmade to the high street. We sell beautiful design led art prints, jewellery and homewares as well as a hosting a wide range of art workshops and courses.

We carefully source and curate our products which are all produced by emerging designers, makers and artists in limited editions or small production runs. So you can find that something truly unique.
name: Turpentine

description: EXHIBIT Gallery is an experimental art space situated in the Golden Lane Estate; a highly regarded Modernist housing complex built in the 1950s in the City of London. Working directly with new talent, the Gallery provides curators, collectors and art lovers with a destination to find and shop unique pieces.
name: Exhibit

description: A treasure trove for anyone with an interest in food, cooking or entertaining, Kooks Unlimited have been supplying locals and culinary experts with high-quality kitchen and cookwares for over 25 years.
name: Kooks Unlimited
Bias
founder_quote: The idea of owning a boutique came about in February 2012 when, after 28 years in teaching, I found myself no longer in education. Six months later, with a business course under my belt, Bias opened on 31 August.
description: We are a lifestyle store specialising in Scandinavian and European womenswear, menswear, homeware and bath and beauty. Beginning in stylish South London,  Bias Peckham opened in 2012 and rapidly grew into a distinctive shopping destination for anyone seeking Scandi inspired, versatile and unique products that you can't find on the high street. We are delighted to have since opened Bias Harrogate in Autumn 2016.

name: Diverse
description: Creative Director and boutique owner Saskia Lamche keeps the Diverse fashion offering innovative and current with emerging designers alongside more established labels; think Bella Freud, A.P.C., Masscob, MM6 and Celine to name a few. Diverse has been part of the  London fashion landscape since 1987.
founder_quote: "We’re fashion lovers ourselves so everything about the boutique - and the labels we work with - has a basis in our own discoveries and preferences."

We started Cornercopia 5 years ago as part of an empty shops project in Brixton Village. Our idea was to create a corner shop with a difference - where the things on the shelves were made by local people, using ingredients locally grown or sourced and everything had a story to tell about it's provenance. The Homeware store was established in December 2013 and for this we source useful and beautiful things from near and far. Some things are made locally, many by traditional methods.
description:
We sell useful, beautiful and curious things for the home from a tiny shop in the vibrant heart of Brixton Village market. Things that are designed to last, functional and beautiful as well as  a few things are cleverly upcycled or one-off curious vintage finds.

We have plenty of cookware, from enamel pie tins and colourful ptichers to wooden utensils and cast iron tea pots. There are things for measuring, things for preserving, things for the mycologist, mixologist and forager. Brushes for cooking and cleaning, iron hooks and wooden pegs for hanging things and curious foxy doorknobs. 

We are especially fond of  hand-crafted objects and things made by traditional methods. We are also building up a range of beautiful things designed by local people.  

Like our local larder, the homeware shop is seasonal with things like garden tools, planters & seeds in the spring, picnic, BBQ and outside gear for the summer and in the  winter we  wooly draft excluders, chestnut roasters and lambswool throws.

Cornercopia's local larder is just next to  the Homeware store and on the shelves of our small shop you will find jars of  jam made with fruit collected from local gardens and allotments, honey made by South London bees, next to pots of mango and habenero relish and bottles of Brixton Pound sauce made using ingredients sourced in Brixton market.  
We also sell some fantastic beers form local micro-breweries and some of the best English spirits and fruit liqueurs.  We have chosen some of the best local products to make some very special hampers full of delicious local products not available elsewhere. These are available on Street-hub to be delivered to your door, or you can come directly to the shop and put together a bespoke hamper.
name: Brixton Cornercopia
Lowie
description:
Inspired by the world’s rich mosaic of traditional handicrafts whose origins date back to the Middle Ages, Lowie re-interprets these time-honoured practices in a totally modern way - creating timeless yet quirky pieces that people will fall in love with.

Started in 2002 by designer Bronwyn Lowenthal, Lowie’s philosophy is to produce beautiful clothing as ethically as possible, without jeopardising design. ‘We aim to pay our hand makers and small manufacturers a decent price, while small production runs ensure each piece is a limited edition’, says Lowenthal. 

Lowie consistently produces a tight collection of sought-after pieces using only the finest soft wools, luxurious organic and recycled cottons and top quality leather. Hand-knitting, crochet, hand-stitching and hand-embroidery are also incorporated into many Lowie garments. Each season a print is designed  in-house, creating an aspect within each collection that is totally unique to the Lowie brand.

From label staples like classic tea dresses and soft cashmere berets to highlight pieces such as vintage inspired dresses and delicate mohair lacy knee socks, Lowie is firmly established as a truly unique fashion label. 

Worn by fashionistas including Liberty Ross, Erin O'Connor, Lily Cole, Fearne Cotton, Rachel Khoo and fashion-forward individuals like you, each Lowie customer appreciates the time, thought and effort that have gone into each high quality, quirky piece.
founder_quote: Apart from my own label Lowie, I love sourcing new and interesting designers that bridge the gap between wearability and art.  We also sell well known great quality staple brands like Petit Bateau and a wide selection of jewellery, accessories and gifts.
"If it doesn't challenge you, it won't change you!"
description: Founded by former banker and businesswoman Akriti, Urbiana is a jewellery and fashion accessories boutique based in the heart of Brick Lane, London. The team curate a selection of own brand products and bespoke pieces from young designers across the globe, all of which are hand-made and fair-trade.
name: Urbiana

founder_quote: We focus on simplicity achieved through good quality basic items, as we believe that simple and comfortable clothing makes the person look effortlessly beautiful. Our collection aims at evoking a lifestyle based on uncomplicated elegance through the use of clothes with minimal, clean cuts and simple designs.
name: Wonderound
description: W O N D E R O U N D is a Life Style Design Web Store based in London. We Represent Simple ,Well Designed, Quality and Craft Creatures For Your Everyday. Concept under 'Everyday with Light' We Hope to Provide a Unique Point Of View That Helps You Find Your Own Style .

name: Indian Summer
founder_quote: Owner Ruth Green has created a treasure trove of shabby chic girliness. Dressing tables are overflowing with gorgeous jewellery, rails of clothing which includes Indian Summer's own label sit along side tables full of scented candles, pretty photo frames, silk knickers and all sorts of wonderful girlie gifts. There is even a section full of retro toys to keep little people and their dads happy!
description:
Indian Summer opened its doors on the Fulham Road in 2004, owner Ruth Green has created a magical experience to take you away from the soulless rails of the high street, gathering the inspiration of travel, colour and curiosity with all the charm of an Indian bazaar in this unique boutique.

Only the best and most beautiful make this bazaar. VOGUE magazine chose the boutique for its list of 100 greatest shops – ‘the secret addresses you must remember’. Boho mixes with nostalgia, the boudoir with the eccentric and you will discover a unique treasure trove of inspiration.

founder_quote: A Portuguese Love Affair was born from our wish to share the best things made in Portugal. Childhood memories, unforgettable flavours and the essence of being Portuguese!
name: A Portuguese Love Affair
description: A Portuguese Love Affair is a lifestyle shop in the heart of East London. Founders Olga and Dina wanted to celebrate the distinctive flavour of their home country, offering a combination of quality, authenticity and style. Their carefully-curated range includes fine products from Portugal, where the provincial meets the cosmopolitan.

founder_quote: A family-run business at heart, Mia Wood is run by Mia and her daughter Jessica and their friendly team, selecting a variety of items ranging from artisan tableware to designer accessories.  The theme of mixing the contemporary with the more traditional lies at the core of the products on offer at the boutique.
name: Mia Wood
description: A family-run business at heart launched in 2003, Mia Wood is run by Mia and her daughter Jessica and their friendly team, selecting a variety of items ranging from artisan tableware to designer accessories.  The theme of mixing the contemporary with the more traditional lies at the core of the products on offer at the boutique.

founder_quote: Our outstanding design showroom is a haven stocked with irresistible items with which to decorate your home. Constantly on the look-out for new and exquisite products from small independent suppliers and artisans worldwide, each piece is carefully selected for style and quality. As well as beautiful and unique furnishings and accessories, Jenny Blanc is the perfect place to shop for that special gift!
name: Jenny Blanc
description: Jenny Blanc is an award winning, international interior design practice with lifestyle showrooms in Teddington, West London and St. James, Barbados. Their two showrooms are a portal to the Jenny Blanc brand of luxury design, where visitors come to be inspired by unique furniture and home accessories sourced from around the world, including own-branded collection of furniture and lifestyle accessories. Both showrooms offer professional Interior Design advice and assistance – from choosing the right fabric and wallpaper to ordering bespoke curtains, blinds or cushions.

name: Number Six
description: Tucked away in the heart of East London's Old Truman Brewery, Number Six first opened its doors in early 2009. Founded by Joe and Jake, Number Six is committed to creating a collection of selected menswear centred around quality and design. Bringing together products sourced from around the world and local brands from their own neighbourhood, Number Six has created a space where menswear meets lifestyle.
founder_quote: "We generally like to avoid trends, focusing more on whether the product will last for a decade rather than a season. We take pride in having created an environment where you can expect excellent quality, under-the-radar brands and genuine advice."
Based in Shoreditch, Pärla is a go to for contemporary, sustainable and Scandinavian inspired jewellery design.
description: With sustainability and Scandinavian design at it's heart, Pärla showcases a small collective of British, Swedish and Norwegian designers each of whom craft pieces that can be worn from season to season or to update a classic look with an individual statement.
name: Pärla

description: Lali Shop is a dramatic, Bauhaus-inspired space curated by former womenswear designer and all-round aesthete Nelli Turner. A stylish addition to vibrant Golborne Road in West London, expect to discover studio ceramics, prints and stationary alongside womenswear, accessories and jewellery from cult labels and independent makers.
name: Lali Shop
founder_quote: Lali Shop is part gallery part installation, a carefully curated and constantly evolving collection of pieces that inspire me in the heart of Golborne Road market. Come and explore in the shadow of iconic Trellic Tower and see London at its most vibrant and creative.

We aim to give you a fresh experience at The West Village with our exciting and unique mix of labels from around the world. We scour the globe so you don't have to. Our boutique has become the go-to destination for those in the know looking for our particular take on the current looks. It's an unmissable selection - take a look at some selected pieces here or come and see us in store to see our collections in full.
description: The West Village is a contemporary womenswear boutique based in London. It was launched in 1999 by Lucy Benzecry who cut her teeth in the fashion world firstly at British GQ and subsequently at British Vogue. The West Village has gained popularity over the years for its feminine styling with a sharp edge which can be found in its interesting mix of contemporary fashion labels together with its retro-styled, print-based eponymous collection. The West Village was the first independent ever to open in Selfridges and in 2016, celebrates 14 years trading from its flagship store in Notting Hill.
name: The West Village

founder_quote: At FAIR we lovingly select beautiful, individual, quality items for you, your wardrobe, your family and your home to show that Fair Trade and ethical fashion and household goods are stylish, functional and affordable. Of course, our producers are at the heart of what we do. We support organisations working hard to generate a livelihood through the use of traditional craft and skills by either purchasing their products or working with them to create new products perfect for the UK (and FAIR!). Any brands we stock must have strong ethical credentials including Fair Trade production and the use of environmentally friendly materials. Buying Fair Trade feels fantastic and we think everyone should be able to experience that.
name: FAIR
description:
FAIR is one of the only shops in the country to specialise in Fair Trade and ethical fashion.

Located in the city of Brighton and Hove, we opened our doors in 2008 to offer the residents of Brighton and Hove beautiful, fair trade products from around the world. We are located at fashion landmark 21 Queen’s Road which was home to Brighton Biba in the 1960s.

At FAIR we stock a range of different brands whose ethical credentials are second to none, not only in their support for Fair Trade production but increasingly through the use of organic and sustainable fabrics. We have a fabulous range of womenswear and childrenswear and a developing selection of menswear as well as products for your home.

So why Fair Trade? For us at FAIR, it’s a completely different way of doing business that ensures people and the planet get the respect that they deserve. Awareness of the social and environmental costs of “fast fashion” has grown tremendously in the last few years and consumers are increasingly seeking out alternatives. We are here to offer those alternatives and show consumers that there is another way.

Since 2008, FAIR has been nominated for a number of local and national ethical fashion awards. Most recently, FAIR has been nominated in the category of Best Independent Boutique for the Ethical Fashion Forum’s 2012 Source Awards.  This award recognizes best practice in the curation, marketing and sale of sustainable fashion through a multi brand platform.

name: Barüch
description: BARÜCH (pronouced BA-ROOK) is a clothing and lifestyle store and brand based East London since 2015. The focus has always been to carry effortless minimalist inspired pieces, stocking a unique mix of African and Scandinavian brands.The BARÜCH capsule collections are created in the London, by the founder Angela Knowles. These are made in small batches using African textiles to compliment garments from Scandinavian brands.

Inspired by the independent shopping scene in San Francisco, two former television producers, Ella Wells and Marc Lewis, opened the cool unisex store Our Daily Edit in Brighton. Their aim is to introduce lesser-known labels and emerging designers to stylish Brightonians and beyond.
founder_quote: Inspired by the independent shopping scene in San Francisco, two former television producers, Ella Wells and Marc Lewis, opened the cool unisex store Our Daily Edit in Brighton. Their aim is to introduce lesser-known labels and emerging designers to stylish Brightonians and beyond.
name: Our Daily Edit
Material
founder_quote: Material presents a unique selection of design-led prints, books and products. Working closely with artists, designers and publishers to carefully select and collaborate on a great range of products.
description: MATERIAL presents a unique selection of design led prints, books and products. With a focus on celebrating designers and makers, the team work closely with artists, designers and publishers and carefully select and collaborate on a great range of products. At MATERIAL you will discover limited edition artist prints, books, homewares and stationery, both online and in their London store.

founder_quote: We handpick key pieces from a wide range of brands not found anywhere else in South London and specialise in the super stylish Scandi brands that have taken the fashion world by storm.
description: White Feather is an independent boutique based in Herne Hill, selling stylish clothing, shoes and accessories for women. We seek brands from all over the world to offer our customers something different and particularly specialise in the super stylish Scandi brands that have taken the fashion world by storm.
name: White Feather
The Hackney Draper
founder_quote: After years of creating bespoke curtains and blinds for some of London's most beautiful homes, a bricks and mortar store was an obvious next step. We do a lot of travelling, and love repurposing vintage and unique fabrics in the form of cushions and throws. Supporting local and emerging suppliers is important to us too, with many of our products made locally and ethically.
description: An independent drapers and homeware store, nestled in the heart of Chatsworth Road, The Hackney Draper offers a unique range of fabrics, soft furnishings and gifts. Handed down through four decades in the upholstery trade, we also offer bespoke services in curtains, blinds and upholstery.

founder_quote: Our emphasis is on timeless design and appeal; classical and non-fussy. Central to our vision is the belief that a stimulated and happy childhood will ensure a healthy future for the whole planet.
description:
Loula and Deer is Brighton based boutique offering divine yet practical toys and accessories for babies and toddlers. Loula and Deer is a place for new parents who want the highest quality unique gifts for them and their children that nurture growth, foster imagination and focus on the good. Good for the environment and good for the family.

At Loula and Deer we offer a variety of gifts from the softest swaddling blankets to organic candles for new Mums; from the softest rattle to a portable dolls house; from stacking alphabet blocks to kaleidoscopes and many more, all sourced from ethical independent suppliers in the UK, Europe and beyond.
name: Loula and Deer

description:
Part of a unique collection of independent shops and businesses in leafy East Dulwich, Roullier White have been offering a stylish and quirky collection of home and lifestyle goods for over a decade. We also produce our own line of luxury home and body care products with the Mrs. White's range, based on original, all-natural recipes passed down by our owner's great grandmother. 

In addition to our selection of lifestyle wares, we also stock the largest collection of rare, artisan perfumes in the U.K, with exclusive access to scents from internationally acclaimed perfumers including Uèrmì, Sammarco, Smell Bent, Jimmy Boyd, Imaginary Authors, and Hierbas de Ibiza to name just a few!
name: Roullier White

description: Gemma, Jack and Kate opened Nook in Stoke Newington in April 2012. With a number of years' experience in retail under their belts, the creative trio combined their experience with their shared love of design and interiors, only stocking products they would have in their own homes. They specialise in products that are well designed and built to last.
name: Nook
founder_quote: We opened Nook in Stoke Newington in April 2012. With a number of years’ experience in retail behind us, which we combined with our shared passion for design and interiors, we wanted to curate the shop that we would like to shop in.

description: Handpicked products from the best independent boutiques across the country.
name: Trouva Shop
founder_quote: Buy something special for your loved ones. We now offer Trouva gift vouchers, which can be used across any of our hundreds of independent boutiques, each selling a carefully curated selection of unique products

name: Cimmermann
founder_quote: We launched in 2004 with the opening of our first shop in Harrogate. In 2007 we moved to a bigger, better showroom to expand our furniture and lighting ranges. We are a family run business run by us - husband and wife partnership Matt & Helen.
description: The companies we choose to work with have been selected very carefully to ensure quality and classic design that will never date, only improve with age. Buying a piece of furniture, a light or working together to design a room in your house or business should bring happiness and excitement which is one of our main beliefs. We hope the products we sell give you as much pleasure and inspiration as they do us.

founder_quote: Twisted Time launched in April 2010 and was the first online watch boutique specialising in design focused watches from up and coming brands and designers. The idea to create a carefully selected collection of modern designer watches was conceived by Alan and Kelsey, self-confessed watch and design enthusiasts. To this day Alan and Kelsey continue to personally review and choose the best watch designs and though the styles vary, all are chosen because they stand out from the crowd in terms of both design and quality.
description: Alan and Kelsey were motivated to start Twisted Time when they began to notice that a lot of watches available on the high street where quite mundane and not really design focused. They started to realise that there were actually very few places out there selling affordable watches that were edgy and cool but also made from high quality materials and craftsmanship.
name: Twisted Time

founder_quote: "I think the future of retail holds a much more personalised shopping experience as things become easier to manufacture and more accessible. I am constantly inspired by the designers and makers that I work with, they are some of the most inspiring and creative people I've had the pleasure to get to know."
name: Hannah Zakari
description: Founded by Rachael Griffiths as an online store in 2004, Hannah Zakari has since grown to open its doors as a bricks-and-mortar boutique in 2010. Originally stocking just her own designs, Rachael soon developed contacts across the world and began selling the work of designers and makers internationally. With an underlying ethos of supporting independent artists and local talent, Hannah Zakari houses a carefully curated and unique collection from jewellery to limited run prints and stationary.

Swedish House at Home was born out of a love of beautiful, simple and functional design. Having spent her childhood in Sweden, owner Michaela grew to love the landscapes and the challenging living conditions of the Northern Hemisphere – the harsh weather and lack of natural light in the long winter months, the bright sun-drenched summers when the sun barely sets. Her outdoor upbringing has inspired her range of products, showcasing simple, functional products made from natural materials.
founder_quote: Swedish House at Home was born out of a love of beautiful, simple and functional design
name: Swedish House At Home

description:
The concept was founded by design duo Jonathan Sellwood and Jonathan Parkin, who combined their creative talent to curate a hand-picked selection of lighting, furniture, wallpapers, fabrics, tableware, home fragrance and gifts, sourced from all over the world. 

The showroom is in the Cotswold town of Winchcombe, Sudeley Castle is just down the road. Cheltenham and Broadway are both 8 miles away.

The Art Gallery showcases works by both established & up-and-coming artists. A selection of original midcentury lithographs is always on display alongside changing exhibitions.

Take a break from shopping in the relaxing Champagne Garden - open when the sun shines.
founder_quote: Our Cotswold showroom is home to a curated selection of the finest decorative objects, luxurious gifts, home fragrances and tableware from a range of established designers from the UK and beyond.
name: Barnbury
Soma Gallery
founder_quote: Soma opened in June 2004 as a shop and gallery promoting contemporary art, design and illustration. Soma specialises in limited edition prints by illustrators and printmakers and has several exhibitions a year. Alongside the prints Soma sells a wide range of artworks, textiles, jewellery, ceramics, magazines and books.
description: Soma opened in Clifton Village in June 2004 as a shop and gallery promoting contemporary art, design and illustration. Soma specialises in limited edition prints by illustrators and printmakers and has several exhibitions a year. Alongside the prints Soma sells a wide range of artworks, textiles, jewellery, ceramics, magazines and books.

founder_quote: "Retail is forever changing, but I always think there will be a place for bricks and mortar shops. As touching, seeing and holding the products are so important. Trouva is the perfect balance!"
name: Home By Kirsty
description: Born from a love of design and a belief that homes should inspire, Home byKirsty presents a collection of beautiful, modern products, curated by owner Kirsty Patrick. The boutique is based within Cardiff, in a small but perfectly formed coach house in Roath. Ranging from unique jewellery to statement light shades, Kirsty sources her products from leading British and Welsh designer-makers who share a clean, contemporary aesthetic.

founder_quote: TOJO represents a modern collection of products and objects. Founded in 2010, TOJO is a specialist purveyor of design products, with a design store in Glasgow. We work with world renowned furniture manufacturer's, and carefully consider our products to create our TOJO collection. Brand and quality are very important to us, along with products that exude character, as we have a real enthusiasm for design. Our selection of products on show reflect the TOJO personality.
name: TOJO
description: At our Store, in Glasgow's Merchant City, we are able to showcase some of the best modern furniture, lighting and accessories.

founder_quote: Discover a selection of stylish, high quality candle holders, vases, kitchenware, cushions, ornaments, candles, toiletry bags, rugs, scarves, jewellery and children's gifts. All the products reflect the Scandinavian way of living, which is simple, functional and stylish.
description: Butikken (pronounced boo-tik-ken) means "The Shop" in Danish. We offer a wide selection of contemporary Scandinavian products developed by mainly Danish designers and all imported from some of the most popular suppliers in Scandinavia. We have a passion for everything nice and all our products are hand picked and things we personally love.
name: Butikken

founder_quote: Pencil Me In are super passionate about bringing their customers products from awesome British Creators. They select items that you will need for yourself as well as making excellent gifts.
description:
At Pencil Me In we are super passionate about bringing you products from awesome British Designers, Illustrators & Makers. We select items that you will need for yourself as well as making excellent gifts.

We work from our boutique store which is on 27 Batchen Street in Elgin, Scotland. Follow our social media @PencilMeInShop on Instagram/Twitter
name: Pencil Me In Shop
ANNUAL
founder_quote: We haven’t just chosen these things to keep your little ones quiet. Every product offers longevity from the quality materials used, eco-awareness, design flair and clever function. Each item has been chosen because it serves a purpose; to entertain, to educate or to encourage your child’s individuality.
description: Bright, fun and bold defines the product offering at Lincoln-based ANNUAL. ANNUAL encompasses the ever precious time spent with children, they want to enrich these moments by curating a range of products that help develop your child’s imagination, creativity, personality and identity.

founder_quote: Cassius & Coco handpicks both emerging and renowned, local and international designers who are taking creative risks to manufacture one-of-a-kind objects. They support a more conscious way of shopping with our focus on design excellence with an emphasis on craftsmanship and sustainability.
name: Cassius And Coco
description: Cassius & Coco opened in Crouch End village in 2015 with a concept around showcasing surprisingly different lifestyle and design products. Cassius & Coco handpicks both emerging and renowned, local and international designers who are taking creative risks to manufacture one-of-a-kind objects. They support a more conscious way of shopping with our focus on design excellence with an emphasis on craftsmanship and sustainability.

founder_quote: "For us, AIDA has always been about the experience - inviting you to share our inspiration and our ideals. From this, we set about creating a multi-concept store that reflects Shoreditch."
description: AIDA is a multi-concept store that reflects the creative, vibrant area in which they are based. They are careful to source brands that are as passionate, from the clothing to the coffee to the community projects they develop. Each item is chosen for their effortless style, quality materials and strong philosophy.
name: Aida

description: The name ‘Black Bough’ is inspired by a short Ezra Pound poem which reads “The apparition of these faces in the crowd; Petals on a wet, black bough”. The poem can be read as seeing beauty in every day things and this is the philosophy behind the shop.
founder_quote: Black Bough is an independent shop set up by Adam Withington and Alex Barter in March 2011, stocking items that are well made, well designed and… well priced. Some of the things that they stock are old, some are new, all are made with consideration and care.
name: Black Bough
Thread
founder_quote: "When buying and curating our collection, the main focus for me is providing quality products. I enjoy working to bring my customers the very best in local and global design"
description: When buying from a new collection or looking for new exciting brands, Thread's emphasis is always on excellent quality crafted garments, whether these are sourced locally in the UK or globally, Thread brings you the very best in menswear design. The owner, Chris, seamlessly blends their in-house designs with clothing and accessories from handpicked brands.

founder_quote: "It's tough out there on the high street with huge overheads but I believe that there will always be a place for independent retail with a loyal local customer base. Modern bricks-and-mortar retailing is all about cherry picking the ultimate products for your customer whilst building a community and an experience for your customers."
description: After a long and successful career in fashion, PREP founder Holly Wilson was looking for a new challenge during her maternity leave. Having lived in Stoke Newington for a number of years renovating her own home, she noticed a lack of cook shops offering niche and design-led brands for foodies in the area. She set out to create a space that was unlike the stack-them-high cook aesthetic and PREP lives up to her aim. Stocking beautiful and unusual kitchenwares, it has become a key shopping destination within the local community.
name: Prep

founder_quote: "We strongly believe in the democracy of design: that good design and beautiful objects have a positive impact on your life and need not be exclusive or prohibitively expensive. Our products have been sourced from far and wide to bring together a unique collection."
name: Snowhome
description: Snowhome was founded in 2001 by artist and print maker Angus McArthur after a move to York from London. With a mission to source gifts and homewares that aren't readily available on the high street, Snowhome has become a destination for quality, design-led products. Angus and his team work with small manufacturers as well as designing their own range of products to ensure their customers can find functional objects and accessible design.

Maze, located in Clifton, Bristol and run by Hannah Holloway, was first opened in 1985 by Hannah’s parents Glenn and Gill. Specialising in fashion and accessories, the boutique was originally a menswear store, but quickly expanded to include womenswear. Over the past 32 years, the team have developed a deep understanding of their customers, the fashion industry, and the art of curation and the importance of visual merchandising.
name: Maze
founder_quote: “As a family business, the shops have always been an extension of our lifestyle. Every part of it is personal and this is why people connect with what we do. It’s about more than just about selling clothes; it’s about creating a space for people to browse, socialise and connect.”

description: Mink Interiors showcases curated collection of some of the best modern interiors products from the around the globe from independent designers and makers, to leading and established design brands. An interior design and styling studio as well as a boutique, the focus is on soft industrial style and Scandinavian design.
name: Mink Interiors

founder_quote: "Years of travelling in exotic places had turned me into a bit of a collector of interesting finds, people were always telling me I should open a shop. As well as my travels, I find real inspiration in good design that stands the test of time."
name: The Scandinavian Shop
description: Based on the Scottish coast, The Scandinavian Shop has been trading for over 40 years, quickly becoming an essential part of the local community. Taken over by owner Lucy Paterson in 2009, it has continued to be a destination for the best in Danish design, offering a collection of gift, homewares and accessories. With Lucy's wealth of experience in collecting beautiful items from her travels, this boutique is a treasure trove of unique and stylish pieces sourced from Scandinavia.

name: The Hambledon
founder_quote: "I was literally almost born into retail - my mum used to own a shop and went back to work when I was 6 weeks, in a basket under the counter! I think there is a real worth in traditional shopkeeping, in kind staff, unusual product and creating a lovely place to be."
description: First opened in Winchester in 1999, The Hambledon was born from founder Victoria Suffield's desire to sell beautiful objects across all product categories and to become a mini department store. The Hambledon has become a destination for discerning shoppers after everything from gifts, books and homewares to fashion and accessories. A pioneer in the independent community, The Hambledon recently won Best Independent Retailer in the UK at the Drapers Indie Awards.

founder_quote: Spoke & Stringer's philosophy is about thriving on adventure and escapism whether you find this on a custom motorcycle, surfboard, push-bike, skateboard or design, fashion and the arts.
name: Spoke And Stringer
description: Ride culture encompasses the sub-culture of motorcycle customisation, creative surfboard design, bicycle design and related apparel. We firmly believe that a healthy body and mind play in your ability to maximise your freedom.

The Alresford Linen Company is a lifestyle shop that showcases a carefully curated collection of products from all over the world. 
Whether you're looking for items to enhance your home, or a gift for a certain someone - we put emphasis on finding things that are unusual, unique and that you won't find on the conventional High Street.
founder_quote: Alresford Linen is a lifestyle shop filled with homewares, gifts and an abundance of colour. They travel far and wide sourcing products that are always well-designed and great quality.
name: Alresford Linen Company

description: The store is constantly evolving and offers some of the most sought after clothing and lifestyle brands available. A proudly Cheltenham based store we aim to compliment and better our location by displaying exclusively local artwork  and working closely with some of the towns best creatives to use our space as a hub for forward thinking. Our store is light and welcoming. We look forward to meeting you.
founder_quote: Established in 2013 The Union Project is a contemporary menswear boutique offering a finely edited selection of new heritage brands from across the globe. Self-initiated and self-funded the purpose of The Union Project is to bring together and support the likeminded who share values of independence, real quality and simple living.
name: The Union Project

description: We are really pleased to be showcasing our products on Trouva, it's a fantastic way for independent stores like ours to bring our products to a wider audience.  We are great believers in filling your home with things that tell a story about you, and bring your home to life.  All of our products have a personality and a sense of fun about them, we like things that make us smile! We hope you enjoy browsing our products and find something that makes you smile too.
founder_quote: We’ve been described as a ‘little slice of London’ and a ‘magical store’ by our lovely customers who are becoming regular visitors since we opened our doors in October 2015.  Our store, Feather and Nest, is located in the pretty riverside town of Wallingford in a beautiful old listed building steeped with character. You won’t find another store like ours in the local area, we pride ourselves on being different, and offering cool, tasteful stuff for you and your home.
name: Feather And Nest

description: After specialising in lighting for a number of years, Holloways of Ludlow introduced its first home store in Kent. Opened in October 2015, the boutique is a showcase of the very best in modern and classic design; furniture, ceramics, tableware sit alongside a collection of lighting. Working with a wide range of designers both in the UK and internationally, Holloways of Ludlow presents a number of styles in a cohesive and accessible way.
name: Holloways Of Ludlow
founder_quote: "We love products that use simple yet beautiful design and materials to create something unique. There is something special about walking into a bricks-and-mortar shop where objects capture your eye in every direction and inspire you through their display."

name: Welcome Home
founder_quote: Focused on making design and craft accessible to all, it provides an evolving space for new and more established designers’ work. Welcome Home is a place to shop for inspiration as well as great gifts and products that are handmade, well designed, useful, beautiful or all of the above.
description: Welcome Home is run by designer Mhari McMullan and opened its doors on 3rd October 2009 in Glasgow's west end. The shop is now situated in the Centre for Contemporary Arts and provides a showcase and creative retail space for craft, design and illustration.

Founded by friends Lottie and Nell, Debbie Bliss was inspired by internationally renowned knitwear designer and Nell's mother Debbie. Starting out online as a lifestyle brand to compliment Debbie's yarn business, Debbie Bliss boutique soon grew and moved to its current location in Walthamstow. Customers flock to the shop, not just for their beautiful products, but to catch a glimpse of Debbie herself, who was awarded an MBE in 2015 for her services to knitting.
founder_quote: "We have really seen an increase in customers who have an interest in shopping from independent boutiques that stock a selection of unusual and design led products. Our community is a close knit, creative hub so we listen to what our customer wants and enjoy taking their ideas to suppliers and trade fairs."
name: Debbie Bliss Home
Lissom + Muster
description: Based in a former cotton mill in Cheshire, Lissom + Muster was founded by John Rogers as a space to allow him to work directly with both suppliers and designers to supply his customers with the finest quality products. Now boasting their own range of menswear, created with materials sourced and made in the UK, Lissom + Muster strives to adhere to its mission of providing quality products made with care, consideration and expertise.
founder_quote: "I think retailers have to focus on great products and great service, but delivered in the ways customers now want to engage with them. Whatever happens we need to find the space for producers to design and make things expertly, and for whoever sells the products to understand and care about them such that customers can make informed choices and are served well."

Based in the beautiful village of Cuckfield, Neilson handpicks from collections that place a premium on using the finest materials and quality workmanship. Pieces are more often than not in a timeless neutral colour palette and a joy to wear.
description:
Since its launch in Cuckfield in 2005 Neilson Boutique has become an established, trusted and fun shopping experience for fashion lovers. Created by sisters who put all their fashion experience, passion for design and shopping together to create what has become a  favourite for like minded people around Sussex and beyond.

They are proud to be listed amongst the best 50 boutiques outside London by The Telegraph, Vogue and featured in the Times Boutique of The Week.

Their most coveted labels are Isabel Marant, Mascob and Rabens Saloner. These collections have a beautiful, timeless look with a  vintage feel and a fun edge. But most importantly, they like to look like they haven't tried to hard.
name: Neilson Boutique
Lorna Ruby
founder_quote: "We are a generation of online shoppers. There has definitely been a huge shift towards online which is great but I am still confident that people will want the tangible experience that a bricks-and-mortar shop offers."
description: Working alongside her husband Rupert as a fashion agent, the founder Lorna, spent time on the road travelling through some of Europe's most diverse destinations. Inspired by the dynamic movement of design and fashion they began to lovingly create our brand Lorna Ruby, a space where lifestyle and fashion co-exist. They continue to travel  all over Europe and Scandinavia, London, Copenhagen and Paris in order to source their pieces. Their buying process brings together pieces of the finest quality and design with emphasis on sustainability, style and, above all, wearability.

name: Rose & Ammi
description: A botanical boutique based in the heart of Edinburgh complete with a blossoming selection of plants and flowers alongside a careful edit of homewares. Alongside pots, planters and vases there's a wealth of gardening essentials which make great gifts for green-fingered friends and family.

name: Jo & Co Home
description: Jo & Co Home is a family run lifestyle store located in North Cornwall dedicated to thoughtfully sourcing products from suppliers all over the world. The result is a curated, contemporary offering from emerging designers and more established homeware and beauty brands. With a wide range of products and a growing list of suppliers from Cornwall and beyond, Jo & Co Home offers the discerning design-fan an irresistible selection to fill their home with.
founder_quote: "Most people that visit our store say how good it smells! But really - its the eclectic mix of brands from across the world that make us who we are. We love sourcing and discovering new brands both in the UK and internationally."

name: Coban
description: Located in London's Stoke Newington, Coban has been designing premium, contemporary clothing for men since they were established in 1990. Almost thirty years on and the boutique now features apparel alongside lifestyle products and accessories from both its own and other like-minded brands, sourced by owners Mahmut and Yalcin.
founder_quote: "We developed our own menswear line 'Life in Paradigm' because we noticed a gap in the market for simple, classic design at an accessible price point. We have a design studio in house, which allows us to have full creative control and tailor the collection to our customer needs."

name: Anna Lizzio
description: Inspired by the vibrancy of the Mediterranean and Argentina, colour is central to the fashion offering at Anna Lizzio. The owner and namesake Anna Lizzio seeks to uncover little-known brands and introduce them to sartorial shoppers. In true independent boutique style it's a family affair with Anna calling on her mother Jane to be the model for the lookbook. The boutique is also tipped by British Vogue as one of the best fashion boutiques in the UK.

name: 40 Colori
description: 40 Colori fuses Italy’s artisanal tradition with ethical production together to create colourful accessories for modern gentlemen. The brainchild of sibling duo Giulia and Gabriele, 40 Colori handcraft the majority of their products in their own sustainable workshop in Como, which has been a part of the family since their grandmother opened it in her basement some 50 years ago. All materials are also sourced in Italy from leading suppliers that distinguish themselves for their quality and responsible practices.
founder_quote: We are artisanal, ethical, bold. We are 40 Colori.

name: Darling and Gold
description: Darling & Gold is a curated lifestyle boutique for the design-lover on vibrant Chatsworth Road. Housed in an old East End pie and mash shop, discover a range including clothing, accessories, homewares and gifts. With a distinctive aesthetic that fuses Scandinavian simplicity with British style, Darling & Gold showcases the best of British and Danish design.
founder_quote: "I love the idea of having a store where you could buy everything that suits your style - like a mini independent department store. It’s Scandi lifestyle but with an English edge."

name: The Sports Edit
description: The Sports Edit is a destination for fashion-forward activewear offering a carefully curated selection of the most stylish, innovative sportswear sourced from all over the world. Effortlessly blending style with high performance and lasting quality, each item on offer at the boutique offers function without ever compromising on style.

name: Gallery 5
description: A haven for the original and unique, Gallery 5 showcases a carefully curated edit of independent design talent from European and international designers. The shop was founded by Sally Hartfield after quitting her job as a lawyer to pursue her passion for dressmaking which became womenswear brand Matilda & Quinn.

name: Poco Kids
description: You'll find Poco Kids in Cambridge nearby a myriad of other independent boutiques and businesses. With a focus on sourcing unisex, fashion-forward brands for babies and children, Poco Kids only stocks brands that produce quality items that aren't readily available on the high street.
founder_quote: Poco Kids is a hub for Baby and Kids Clothing in the heart of Cambridge. We aim offer exciting clothing and accessories that are not so readily available on the high-street. We chose brands and items that we are passionate about as well as having some kind of social or environmental ethos, which we find so many people are looking out for. We pride ourselves in offering the best edit of Kids fashion that we hope you and your Children will enjoy.

name: Barbican Shop
description: The Barbican focuses on showcasing the work of emerging designers alongside their permanent range, which features products inspired by art, architecture and design, closely linked to their impressive schedule of exhibitions. One of Europe's largest arts centres, a visit to the Barbican is a truly immersive experience.

name: The Square Monmouth
description: The Square Monmouth is an independent womenswear store in the heart of Monmouth, Wales. Set up in September 2015 by long term friends Claire and Tracey, their vision was to bring together the best in terms of stylish, contemporary designs.

name: Squirrel
description: Squirrel, located in Ulverston, Cumbria, and founded by Katie Holmes, offers an eclectic and quirky mix of homeware and accessories. The boutique offers everything from handmade jewellery to colourful home textiles, ceramics and gardenware alongside wide range of high quality children's toys and games to inspire and educate the younger generation. Passionate about drawing people into the shop and interacting with their customers, the boutique also features a craft area and regularly runs craft competitions for children.
founder_quote: “There is room for the independent retailer, in bricks and mortar and online. This sector can only grow, fuelled as it is by owners who care about their products and the experiences they can offer their customers.”

name: Carnill & Company
description: Carnill & Company is a lifestyle boutique located in Southwell, Nottinghamshire, established in 2013 by Richard Carnill. With a background in fashion design and a family history of retail, Richard found himself drawn into the world of interiors and never looked back. Carnill & Co offers a selection of quality products including interior accessories, lifestyle products and gifts sourced from global brands and local artisans. Starting small, they have now expanded into the space next door to showcase their products and style.
founder_quote: "We buy in small quantities to keep our collection as fresh and exciting as possible. This allows us to keep our collection hand picked, unique and diverse."

name: Oxford Brush Company
description: The Oxford Brush Company, which opened in 2014 in the picturesque town of Burford in the Cotswolds, is run by Hamish Lauder and is one of the country's only shops dedicated to brushes. The team sources beautifully hand-crafted brushes in both traditional and modern styles.
founder_quote: “We enjoy solving problems that people didn’t realise they had. Whether they want to clean out a classic car’s carburettor or they need to reach the corner of a kitchen unit, we can help them.”

name: Covet
description: Friends Blaise and Anna founded Covet in 2007 after noticing a gap in the Edinburgh market for quality leather handbags different to those found on the high street and from luxury brands. They offer a curated selection of the best local and up-and-coming designers who produce high quality leather goods unavailable elsewhere in the city. Both artists, Covet have also launched their own collection, offering time-less design and high-end quality.
founder_quote: "Customers are moving away from disposable fashion. There is more interest in where a product comes from as well as the story behind it. We wanted to create a social space for friends to meet, have a drink and browse our collections of lesser known designers and hand made products."

name: Stil Lifestyle
description: STIL Lifestyle, located in Forest Row, Sussex, and founded by Sulaika Weihs, merges premium women’s fashion with beauty in a relaxed, welcoming retail space. Inspired by the unique shopping experiences offered by other stores, Sulaika wanted to create a beautiful and memorable space for her local area and opened the boutique in 2013. Since then, she has worked hard to extend her collection, sourcing her products from a range of distinctive brands.
founder_quote: "I think there will always be a place in the market for independent boutiques due to the level of service and personal touches we can provide. However, an online presence is vital in order to capture a wider audience of customers who aren't from the local area."

name: Home At Five
description: Located in Illfracombe in Devon, Home At Five was founded by Linda and Nigel Tinsley-Such. Recognising a gap in the local market for an independent homewares boutique, they set up shop in a charming basement apartment. The building was reminiscent of the Australian ‘Queenslander’ houses they came across during their travels and felt like the perfect location for their boutique. This dedicated pair curate a selection of artisanal products for the home, from printed cushions to ceramics.
founder_quote: "I believe that retail is moving away from mass-market and mass-produced products. Instead there will be a focus on quality and authenticity and we will see a corresponding growth in the number of independent shops."

name: Concept 65
description: Concept 65 is located in Glasgow and run by Owen Bisset. Inspired by Colette in Paris, Owen set out to open his own concept store in the heart of Glasgow. He draws upon his knowledge of interior design when selecting the contemporary home and lifestyle products for his boutique.
founder_quote: “Despite the growth of online retail, bricks-and-mortar shops are more popular than ever; customers relish the opportunity to see products before they purchase, something they will continue to do for years."

name: JouJou & Lucy
description: JouJou & Lucy is located in London and owned by Goli & Kazem Moshki who have run the boutique for eighteen years. They opened the shop after seeing a gap in the market for quality childrenswear. Passionate about supporting young, upcoming designers, the pair curate a selection of apparel and toys for children which boast distinctive designs.
founder_quote: "We're seeing a growing desire to support the local independent retailers on our high streets as here customers can enjoy traditional customer service."

name: Tracey Neuls
description: Located on Redchurch Street in London, Tracey Neuls is a successful footwear boutique featuring a selection of relaxed styles, designed in house. Tracey has been designing shoes for over 17 years. She draws inspiration from her surroundings and often collaborates with other artists and designers. The boutique’s retail space is both interesting and immersive and shoes are hung from the ceiling to allow them to be viewed from all angles.
founder_quote: “Running a bricks-and-mortar shop allows me to interact with customers daily. I love sharing the inspirations behind my designs and helping them to discover their perfect pair of shoes.”

name: Union 22
description: Union 22 is located in the heart of Liverpool and showcases refined mensware which is curated by owner John Paul Cooper and assistant Terrell. The boutique features apparel sourced from exclusive brands whose clothes exhibit the best of Italian and British style. All items are crafted from luxury materials and are elegantly displayed across the shop floor. The boutique is based in Union House built in 1882 for the Tetley & Co tea merchants. The store maintains original features from this exciting era, providing character and charm.

name: Form Lifestyle Store
description: Form Lifestyle Store is located in Manchester and run by Elly Amoroso and Harry Williams. With experience in retail and graphic design, the pair opened their boutique to showcase simple, graphic pieces. Passionate about supporting independent design, they sell handmade products sourced exclusively from small, independent makers and share the stories behind each with their customers.
founder_quote: “We love learning about each new maker that we take on, hearing their stories and the processes involved in their work.”

name: Design House Norwich
description: As its name suggests, Design House Norwich is located in Norwich and offers homewares for the modern interior. Set in a characterful 17th century building, the boutique is the region’s sole supplier of a number of prestigious European furniture brands including Vitra and Hulsta. With such an international offering, it’s no surprise that the boutique has become a destination for contemporary homeware.

name: Season Cookshop
description: Located in North London, Season Cookshop is a specialist kitchenware boutique selling an array of high quality products. Passionate about cooking, the team thoroughly test their products to ensure that only the best range is on offer. They are able to give customers expert advice to help them find the right product for them and at the right price point, whether they’re searching for a new saucepan or a carving knife.

name: The Women's Society Boutique
description: Like all good ideas, Hertford boutique The Women's Society Boutique was conceived over a glass of wine. Founder Victoria was on holiday in Spain, and realised that she wanted to share her love of fashion with the world. Housed in a Grade II listed building, the luxurious boutique stocks a range of glamorous womenswear for the discerning shopper.
founder_quote: "Trends are moving online but we all crave human interaction - life would be very lonely if we had no retail."

name: The Amazing Crocodile Design Store
description: Trained architect and interior designer Jana discovered her love for design early in life. Her boutique, The Amazing Crocodile Design Store, was opened as a space to indulge this passion, presenting customers with beautiful products from both well-known brands and fresh new designers. On top of her regular work, Jana organises in-store exhibitions every 2-3 months to showcase up-and-coming artisans from all over Europe.
founder_quote: My three daughters inspired the boutique name. Whenever we cross one particular bridge, they always yell out ‘Look, there’s a crocodile!’ That’s where “Amazing Crocodile Design Store” comes from.

name: Melt Chocolates
description: Facing the age-old dilemma of wanting to give her children sweet treats without compromising on quality, mum of four Louise decided to found her own chocolate company. Melt now has two boutiques in London dedicated to making delicious, sustainably produced chocolate that both kids and adults will love.
founder_quote: We are fervently anti-plastic in everything we do - our goal is to source the best chocolate in the world and make it in a sustainable way.

name: Wesen
description: Having studied fashion design in Berlin, Mareike Ulman became acutely aware of the harsh conditions that many fashion employees work under. She realised that she preferred to be her own boss, so she founded her brand in 2008. Three years later Wesen was launched as a small shop and showroom, and has since grown to become a shopping destination for discerning design aficionados.
