founder_quote: I love talking to people who are interested in my products - I'm constantly inspired by different points of view.

name: Eighty Seven
description: Having grown up in Derbyshire, Amy Cook always felt that it was the perfect destination for a beautiful womenswear boutique. She opened Eighty Seven in Melbourne as a space where she could offer her local community thoughtfully selected designs that they would love to wear. Amy handpicks her stock in the knowledge that each item has the potential to make her customers feel truly special.
founder_quote: "I think that people are becoming more invested in knowing that their purchases have supported a small business, and have been picked with care and passion."

name: Bibico
description: Disillusioned with the world of fast fashion, Snow decided to open a boutique whose focus would be the exact opposite; slow fashion made from natural and sustainable fabrics. Bibico in Bath was the result; tucked away on a cobbled street in-between other independents, it's a must-visit for any fans of thoughtful fashion.
founder_quote: "We have been working with many of the same producers for nearly 10 years. Our main supplier is in India, and is a fair trade cooperative that works with women from disadvantaged backgrounds to help them break out of the cycle of poverty."

name: Hus & Hem
description: Founded by Louise Little, Hus & Hem means house and home in Swedish, a suitable name for a shop that sells Scandinavian objects to furnish, decorate and brighten up your home. Bright and light with a mass of colourful products for sale, the Herefordshire-based shop never ventures into the gaudy or kitsch.
founder_quote: "Sometimes the simplest things can bring the most pleasure, like drinking from a beautiful mug, savouring a tiny piece of Danish liquorice or padding around in a pair of Glerups wool slippers. This is what Hus & Hem is all about."

name: Fitique
description: The three active female founders of Fitique were driven to open the boutique by a desire for something different from the standard local fitness retail offering. For those wanting to maintain an active lifestyle, the fitness clothing landscape can be very limited in choice, but Fitique's range offers current designs for today's fashion conscious woman. As well as clothing, Fitique is also home to a fitness studio offering classes including vinyasa yoga and barre.
founder_quote: A fresh take on fitness shopping. Founded in 2015, FITIQUE was brought to life with the sole aim of changing the way women feel when shopping in the sports retail sector, which can be a masculine environment.

name: Mon Pote
founder_quote: The products we stock are things that we hope will have a permanent place in the owner’s life and home, so everything is carefully curated with lasting quality in mind.
description: "Mon Pote" loosely translates from French as ‘my mate’, and the Bristol-based lifestyle boutique lives up to its namesake by offering a friendly shopping experience for its on- and offline customers. The name also applies to store founders Anna and Natalie, who have been friends since school and have always supported each other in business.

name: The Wearer
description: Based in Islington's Camden Passage, The Wearer was founded by Rachel Richards. Rachel is a former accessory and jewellery buyer, meaning the jewellery collection is simultaneously trend-led and timeless.
founder_quote: "I opened The Wearer because I want to support the independent designers and creative talents that I find so inspiring. I focus on London-based designers because there is so much amazing local talent and I can develop real relationships with them."

name: Mauds House
description: 'Located at collaborative space Steep&Filter in North Yorkshire, Mauds House is run by Hattie Crook and is named after her great grandmother. Hattie is passionate about showcasing the work of talented creatives and sources her products from an array of independent designers. The collaborative shop serves North Star coffee, vegan/vegetarian food alongside shelves adorned with beautiful Mauds House wares.
founder_quote: "We love the sense of community that has been created from having a collaborative space here in Skipton. More and more people are visiting the shop in search of products that they can't find readily on the high street."

name: Coastal Scandi
description: Cornwall boutique Coastal Scandi perfectly blends the backgrounds of its two founders - Sean, a home and interior designer, and Isabel, a Sweden-native who loves natural simplicity. The result is a boutique that understands good design and puts an emphasis on finding the best local brands and craftspeople to work with.
founder_quote: "We like to select and support businesses that have a story to tell - the only problem is we need a bigger shop to fit them all in."

description: With a background in marketing and communications, founder James Borely started his retail career with a bespoke lighting brand in 2013. Through designing and buying ranges of lamps, James discovered a world of makers, designers and small brands that he felt were unrepresented in his local area. Starting out as a pop-up shop in Brixton, Resident Store flourished online until James found the perfect space in Frome, Somerset. Now based in a Grade II listed building, Resident Store is a curated collection of unusual homewares and lifestyle products from known brands to up and coming designers.
founder_quote: "I'm inspired by good, simple, essential design. I take a lot of inspiration from architecture having worked in that industry and this is reflected in a lot of our products. At Resident Store we aim to provide a welcoming and relaxed environment, helped along by Resident dog Howie."
name: Resident Store

description: Started in 2010 by friends and mothers Tammy and Clare, eenymeeny aims to provide a fresh alternative to the usual high street children's shop. The London-based shop only sells quality products designed with care, created in a sustainable way with respect to the environment and people involved in the process.
name: eenymeeny
founder_quote: Our products are sure to be treasured and passed on from generation to generation; toys, clothes and books that are all thoughtfully designed and responsibly made...but still fun!

description:
Vanil is an ever-evolving boutique showcasing an eclectic mix of Scandinavian inspired design. 
Every six weeks Vanil refresh their product offering to ensure that customers have a new experience each time they shop with Vanil. The owner, Mandy, feels passionate about creating fresh, exciting shopping experiences for all her customers.
name: Vanil

description: The Hepworth Wakefield is an award-winning art gallery and exhibition space that celebrates the area’s unique artistic legacy and explores the work of major contemporary artists. The gallery shop is home to a stunning range of artist-designed products, homewares, prints and unique gifts by the finest British makers and designers.
name: Hepworth Wakefield
Peppercorn
description: Founders Christopher and Gloria met in Australia and after returning to home to Llandeilo in Wales, they set up Peppercorn in 1987. A cookshop born from their love of cooking and food,  the boutique's shelves stock a selection of kitchen goods, including specialist cookware, every day essentials and design-led tableware. Occupying a historic Grade 2 listed building, this boutique is a real destination for the aspiring chef or gourmet enthusiast.
founder_quote: "When we moved back home to Wales, we wanted to create a space where we could share our love of cooking and food. We opened Pappercorn in 1987 and in recent years our son's Richard and Nicholas have joined, making it a true family run business."

description: Good & Proper Tea's founder Emilie started her venture as a mobile tea van, but soon planted roots in Clerkenwell. She crafts and brews in-house blends of artisanal tea, as well as sourcing beautiful teapots, cups and other accessories for the tea aficionado to peruse.
name: Good & Proper Tea
founder_quote: "We custom brew each tea to ensure the best possible flavour, from Japanese matcha to Chinese oolongs, punchy Indian breakfast teas to zingy Egyptian herbs."

description: All of our products are personally hand selected and have an essence of individuality and integrity. We aim to provide something unique, offering a vibrant, diverse and occasionally quirky range of products for our customers.
name: Rachel Usher
founder_quote: We try to bring together a range of fresh and individual home interior products so we're always on the look out for exciting new designers, products and pieces with the aim of inspiring customers into making their homes as unique as they are.

description: Run by couple Greg Vaitsas and Paulina Filippou, Isle of Olive was born from their passion for Greek produce and a frustration at the lack of shops in London celebrating Greece's exports. Starting on street markets and online, the shop now stands in East London creating a space where customers are transported to a Greek island through the aromas and textures of the natural products they handpick from their home country.
founder_quote: "We are inspired by Greece's nature, by the scents, the tastes and the beautiful Greek notion of "philoxenia" which means welcoming guests and treating them with the warmth one would treat their family."
name: Isle of Olive
ALSO Home
description: The ALSO Home philosophy is to design and source products that are unique and stylish inspired by Scandinavian and Japanese design. All the products have a story to tell; one of quality, uniqueness and individuality. Find us in the heart of the West Sussex countryside where we showcase our stylish range in the beautifully converted Old Brickworks in Rudgwick.
founder_quote: We have worked hard to create a boutique and collection that prizes uniqueness and quality while supporting artisans around the world.

name: Mench Living
description: Based in Hitchin, Hertfordshire, Mench Living brings you beautiful homewares inspired by contemporary Scandinavian design. With a focus on up-and-coming designers, Mench Living have curated a range that will bring your home to life with products in a soft, Scandi-inspired colour palette.
founder_quote: Mench Living brings you beautiful homeware inspired by contemporary Scandinavian design. They focus on up and coming designers and have curated a range of quality products that will bring your home to life.

name: 32 The Guild
description: In Northampton's thriving cultural quarter, 32 The Guild is founder Zoie Walker's solution to the gap in the market for inspiring, design led product. With a background in footwear design, Zoie has curated a collection of hand picked, quality pieces, including womenswear, accessories and gifts.
founder_quote: "It's always been important for me to work in a creative space and 32 The Guild really encompasses all of that. We want customers to experience our store, from the beautiful and inspiring products to the encompassing smells of scented candles and coffee."

name: Berylune
description: Berylune, located in in the charming town of Royal Leamington Spa, was founded by sisters Emily and Amy Davies along with their best friend Zoë Sharp. They set up the business in 2009, initially selling products on cold, Christmas markets, before opening their bricks-and-mortar shop in 2012. The boutique showcases an eclectic mix of products, from genuine vintage pieces to design-led interiors, gifts and accessories, some of which they make, assemble or repackage themselves.
founder_quote: "Some of our best selling items are from our stationery department; tactile pens and beautiful journals in a time when there is an app for everything at your fingertips. We think this return to the tactile will continue and we are excited to see where it will lead us."

name: Apothecary87
description: It all started when owner Sam decided to grow a beard, and soon found that he needed a quality product to help him maintain it. What started out as a small batch of original recipe beard oils, made for himself and eventually friends, quickly became an entire range of grooming products and accessories for the modern man.
founder_quote: A well-groomed man is not merely a man who uses great products on his hair and body, but a man who can present himself in his desired way, through all aspects of his lifestyle.

name: Ivory&Pitch
description: Following 20 years of running a successful interior design business across the south coast and London, Caroline Ivory spotted the perfect opportunity to combine her interior experience with her love of beautiful homewares and design. Ivory & Pitch opened its doors in 2011 and has since become a destination for stylish homewares to suit a modern rustic or urban interior.  Evocative of an old fashioned hardware store with a traditional counter, vintage bell at the door and industrial pendant lights, this is a veritable treasure trove of original and unusual finds.
founder_quote: "There will always be a place for independently run shops, where the personality of the shopkeeper is evident and the quality of the product is high. Inspiring our customers is always at the forefront of our boutique, in our displays and the product itself."

name: Corey Homeware
description: Founder and namesake Corey handpicks an ever-evolving range of affordable and contemporary homewares for design aficionados. Frustrated by unaffordable interior shops across the capital, Corey was keen to join the great mix of traditional markets and emerging cafes and boutiques in London's East End. The vision behind the boutique is to offer a treasure trove of modern design at affordable prices.

name: Peter Hall & Son
description: Peter Hall & Son was established 44 years ago and has been crafting wooden accessories in their workshop, based in the idyllic Lake District, ever since. Seamlessly blending their own works with carefully selected products from British makers, the range at Peter Hall & Son is unique and values quality and craftsmanship above all.

name: What Sarah did
description: Located in the market town of Hitchin in Hertfordshire, What Sarah did is a fashion and lifestyle boutique offering a stylish collection of contemporary apparel and accessories. Fast throw away fashion is rejected in favour of clever investment pieces from brands such as Scotch & Soda, Becksöndergaard and CRU London. Trained fashion stylist Sarah and her team are passionate about building confidence through clothes and are always on hand to offer fashion advice to customers.
founder_quote: "My mantra has always been ‘it’s not what you wear, it’s how you wear it.’ I want to instil my customers with confidence, to show their personality through their outfit choices."

name: Colours May Vary
description: Colours May Vary was founded by Andy Gray and Becky Palfery in 2012, both hailing from creative backgrounds in design and arts libraries respectively. Drawing on their shared experience, the boutique's main focus is graphic art and design, typography and illustration in the form of books, journals, prints and more. Alongside being a boutique, they regularly host exhibitions of work from artists and designers local to Leeds.
founder_quote:
Colours May Vary was founded by Andy Gray and Becky Palfery in 2012 and is a passion project borne of careers in design (Becky) and Arts Libraries (Andy).

We were the first shop in the Leeds area to offer a focus on design books and journals. We have been at our Munro House location for 4 years and are proud to have become part of an incredible community of independent stores in the city. We regularly commission work and collaborate with local businesses as well as designers and illustrators worldwide. 

Our retail side supports an event space where we host regular exhibitions, so when you order an item from us you are also supporting a vibrant show space which is always free to visit.

name: Merchant Menswear
description: Born out of a genuine passion for clothes and independent retailing, Merchant Menswear was established with a mission to present thoughtfully edited brands from across the globe with a strong emphasis on quality fabrics and fits. Whether it's Japanese selvedge denim or handmade British footwear, every item offers understated style and quality.
founder_quote: Born out of a genuine passion for clothes and independent retailing, Merchant Menswear was established with a mission to present thoughtfully edited brands from across the globe with a strong emphasis on quality fabrics and fits.

name: KJ's Laundry
description: KJ's Laundry first opened in 2006 on Marylebone Lane, London, it was the brain child of Jane Ellis and Kate Allis who sought a different, more relaxed independent shopping experience. With a dedicated following returning each season, KJ's Laundry seek out the most stylish pieces from the most interesting and wearable labels.

name: Cuemars
description: Founded by three like-minded friends hailing from Persia, France and the UK, Cuemars is a boutique dedicated to conscious consumerism. The space showcases ethical products, including their own designs. Discover design-led lighting, language inspired clothing and botanical products, surrounded by an abundance of plants and greenery.
founder_quote: "People are starting to show more interest in the production process of products they buy, as well as sustainability and where they come from. I think this will only grow as people turn to independent retailers to provide these types of products, making the link between the maker and the buyer much stronger."

name: Mimi Berry
description: In the heart of Clapton, East London, is Mimi Berry. The founder lends her name to the boutique, and has created her range of signature handbags and leather accessories that marry style and function in order to meet the needs of the modern woman.
founder_quote: In the heart of Clapton, East London, is Mimi Berry. The founder lends her name to the boutique, creating her range of signature handbags and leather accessories that marry style and function to meet the needs of the modern woman.

name: The Little Natural Co.
description: After years of working in the fashion industry the founders saw a gap in the market for a boutique that was consciously dedicated to beautiful trend-led organic products for parent and baby alike. With an emphasis on ethical and sustainable production, Little Natural Co provide beautiful design-led natural products whilst also helping to protect the world they will one day inherit.
founder_quote: With an emphasis on ethical and sustainable production, we hope to provide beautiful design-led natural products for you and your children whilst also helping to protect the world they will one day inherit.

name: Marby And Elm
description: Set opposite the Zetter Townhouse on London's creative Clerkenwell Road, Marby & Elm is home to an ever-expanding range of stationery including greeting cards, prints, scissors and rubber stamps. The majority of their letterpress paper products are designed, printed and packaged in the boutique's in-house studio.

name: Quarters
description: Set up by Richard Murphy in 2013 to share his passion for the definitive, innovative, original and essential products on offer today, Quarters offers a carefully curated selection of mens goods and gifts. From lifestyle accessories, books, contemporary men’s clothing brands, design-led tools and  men’s grooming essentials, discover everything the modern man needs (and wants) at Quarters.
founder_quote: After studying furniture and product design, and working round the world on interiors projects I felt a need to be part of my new home city Edinburgh, so I opened the doors to my studio in Edinburgh, selling a combination of my own vintage finds as well as a selection of authentic products that were definitive, innovative, original and essential. We still use that criteria to search out amazing independent makers as well as more established brands with real heart and integrity.

name: Nooki Design
description: After working in the fashion industry for 15 years producing accessories for other brands, owners Cat and Thuy founded Nooki Design after struggling to find accessories they loved. What started life as accessories soon expanded to include clothing in their signature relaxed style and shapes, as well as their favourite home and lifestyle brands to compliment their own range.

name: Frontiers Man
description: After a successful career in property surveying, Nigel was looking for a new challenge and joined established partner Jane in retail, opening Frontiers Man as a male equivalent of their existing Frontiers Boutique. Seeking to fill a gap in the Edinburgh market for menswear boutique shopping quality independent brands, Frontiers Man focuses on understated style and timeless pieces. In the last 18 months Nigel has been building up contacts and suppliers with leading names such as Folk & Sandqvist and have become a destination for independent menswear brands in the Scottish capital.
founder_quote: "The right kind of retail has a great future ahead with customers actively seeking out great quality products and independent designers both online and offline. I think bricks-and-mortar will always play a key part as people like to interact both with the products and the people making or sourcing them."

name: Studio One Twenty
description:
Studio One Twenty is an independent concept store situated in Angel, Islington on charming Camden Passage. Launched in 2014 by creatives Sara and Alia, the duo have brought together their backgrounds in photography and fashion to create an inspiring shopping experience.
Smaller labels are their focus, showcasing clothing and accessories by new and emerging designers.

name: Ottie And The Bea
description: Founder Julia came up with the concept for Ottie and the Bea after the birth of her second child and since then it has gone from strength to strength. With a focus on usability, design and value at the core of everything she buys, Julia handpicks only products that she knows work and play well. Alongside their products, the space houses community events for local children, book clubs, and a host of workshops, making it a real hub of learning and creativity.
founder_quote: "I set up Ottie And The Bea after the birth of my second child and it has almost become like a third to me now. We take great care in only picking products we know work and strive to create a space for fun and play for all ages."

name: Victoria Beau
description: Established in 2015 by Emma Holland, Victoria Beau is an independent womenswear boutique in Islington. Showcasing a mixture of well loved established brands alongside new up and coming designers Victoria Beau offers a covetable collection of clothing and accessories. Listed by Stylist as one of London's best online boutiques, and seen in WGSN as a boutique you must visit when in London.
founder_quote: "I always love it when people compliment my outfit asking where I've bought something. We pride ourselves on Victoria Beau being one of those shops to find those special pieces."

name: D Copperfield
description: Established in 1973, D.Copperfield has established itself as a great menswear boutique and has received recognition from the British Fashion Council. Based in St Albans, Hertfordshire, the store has recently undergone a substantial renovation and now houses a gents formal and suiting room in its basement to add to the casual brands located upstairs.

name: MONOMONO
description: MONOMONO is a bricks-and-mortar shop and studio in the heart of the creative community in Hove, East Sussex. Set up by Cherise Blythe and Natasha Cooke in June 2017, the boutique sells a curated selection of products from innovative young brands including a collection of MONOMONO products which are designed and made by hand in the studio.

name: Temple Cycles
description: A keen cyclist from the age of 9, founder Matt studied Mechanical Engineering alongside running a small vintage restoration business for classic road bikes, from there he started designing his own custom frames and soon Temple Cycles was born. . Temple Cycles started from the founder Matt's life-long enthusiasm for pedal power, evolving from humble beginnings of fixing bikes in his bedroom to batch producing bikes in the UK.

name: & Hobbs
description: & Hobbs is a beautiful homeware boutique located in Surrey and run by Libby Hobbs. Drawn to people and products with a story to tell or a mystery to uncover, Libby has always dreamed of running a boutique featuring vintage pieces, rustic designs and natural materials. Concerned about our throwaway society, Libby enjoys repairing and reinvigorating used pieces and utilising local materials, a philosophy she follows in her product curation. Any maker that joins the & Hobbs family shares this same ambition and uses sustainable and carefully sourced materials for their products.
founder_quote: "I am passionate about creating memorable experiences for my customers. I regularly run workshops, from brush lettering to photography, to draw people into the shop and allow them to learn new skills."

name: Botany Shop
description: Botany on Chatsworth Road was founded in 2014 by Angela Maynard, after a 12 year career in Product Development for various British brands. Inspired by nature and simple living, Botany Shop is as an ever-changing platform of ideas for the home. Discover a carefully curated selection of ethically sourced hand-crafted homewares, organic skincare products, stationery, paper goods and other objects, alongside an ever-changing abundance of indoor plants life, from unusual succulents, cacti and other house plants to a weekly selection of cut and wild flowers.

name: Neoma Design
description: Founded by Dolores, Neoma Design offers bespoke leather bags which are made in store in Brighton. Dolores works intuitively when designing her bags, responding to the leather with which she’s working. As a result, each bag is unique and expresses its own character. She also runs bag making workshops which allow her to share her craft with her customers.
founder_quote: “When creating my bags, I am inspired by changes in the seasons and the impact that they have on our moods and our senses.”

name: Moonko
description: Our ethos at MoonKo, is to be as kind to the planet as possible.  All of our products are sourced from independent makers who use eco & environmentally materials.  We take great pride in knowing all our makers and suppliers by name.  Every product at Moonko is 100% handmade whether it be a ceramic pot, a piece of jewellery or a screen print.  As well as being a lifestyle boutique we have a passion for all things botanical and sell a range of plants and airplants.

Seagate Hastings was born out of respect for quality, stylish, modern classic menswear and it is one of the Old Town's growing list of exciting independent retailers providing a broad and carefully selected range of premium casual clothing and accessories. Brands which have supported Seagate since day one include Folk Clothing, Sunspel, Universal Works and Realm & Empire; British brands, all of which have fascinating back story and which continue to innovate and surprise.
name: Seagate Hastings
Amelie
description: With an exclusive roster of designers, including Sonia Rykiel, Senso and AG Jeans, Amelie is as destination for fashion-lovers in search of contemporary clothing and accessories sourced from around the world.

name: Kate Sheridan
description: A local resident for over 20 years, Kate Sheridan is well and truly an East End native. A graduate in accessory design, Sheridan has been involved in retail in various ways, eventually specialising in quality leather goods. The solo Kate Sheridan label developed from a mainly online platform, with products sold in boutiques and on her popular Broadway Market stalls, until demand led them to consider a permanent retail space. Now with a design studio in store, Kate Sheridan stocks her own womenswear and accessories line alongside local talent and established designers.
founder_quote: "We have our design and making studio right here in the store, so anyone walking in can see us in the process or creating something. In addition to our own designs we also stock products from a variety of local crafters, small independent companies and plenty of our talented friends."

name: The Collaborative Store
description: Founded by Elena Todary, Marylebone's The Collaborative Store is a place to discover an edit of contemporary clothing and accessories for people who are curious about the story behind the pieces they buy. With an ethos of bringing together brands influenced by culture, rather than fashion trends, The Collaborative Store showcases a range of under-the-radar independent designers.

name: Printer And Tailor
description: Based in Herefordshire, Printer & Tailor has firmly set itself as a destination for shoppers with a keen eye for design. Founded by Karon and Peter Hamilton, the store is driven by their desire to source unique, distinctive and design led products, ranging from homeware and gifts to fashion accessories.
founder_quote: "I envisage independent stores to become more like show rooms, offering unique pieces, in-store experiences and interesting visual merchandising."

name: Stripes Fashion
description: Located in Worcester, Stripes Fashion is based in a former bank built in 1836, and is run by sisters Claire Wright and Jennifer Plant. Its shop floor features marble pillars, high ceilings and gold leaf decorations which hark back to the building’s past creating an air of elegance on the shop floor. This elegance is reflected in their collection of premium, contemporary women’s clothing and accessories. The sisters opened the boutique in 2004, realising a dream to bring inaccessible fashion brands from abroad to the UK and they continue to visit cities such as Paris and Copenhagen.
founder_quote: "We love working in clothing retail as it is a fast-paced, constantly changing, creative industry."

name: Paulin Watches
description: The brainchild of three sisters, Paulin sources materials and components from all over the world, with a focus on supporting British manufacturers and using environmentally sustainable practices. The Paulin sisters were inspired by their great grandfather George Henry Paulin, a distinguished sculptor who worked throughout both World Wars across London and Glasgow. Paulin's workshop is situated in Glasgow’s Merchant city, a creative space that acts as an office, shop, studio and leather workshop.

Another Country has a simple, honest aesthetic which is applied to all products they stock, whether they craft them themselves or whether they're made by a select group of British and European designers. With an emphasis on sustainability and longevity, discover traditional kitchenwares, decorative objects and design-led stationery reinvented for the discerning, modern customer.
founder_quote: I hope shoppers will fall in love with what we feel is great, sustainable design that people can enjoy every day.
name: Another Country

founder_quote: Pedlars’ varied stock ranges from pieces produced here in Britain to items from across the globe. Interested in products with stories to tell, with patina, history and a good dose of warmth and fun.
description:
Our Mission

To offer beautiful, exclusive products to won’t find elsewhere, most of which are made just for us to our design in small factories and workshops.
To offer an open and warm environment in our shop and in store coffee shop. 
To support British manufacturers, artists and designers whenever we can.
To source the best, most interesting vintage pieces for your home.
To offer great quality, fantastic value and excellent service.
To listen to and talk to our customers. To be open to ideas.
To employ passionate people.
To be leaders, opinion formers and to create a company unlike any other.
To create a website that is a go to source of inspiration, ideas and stories as well as great product.
To not take ourselves too seriously.
name: Pedlars
Design Vintage
description: With stores in Brighton and Chichester, Design Vintage offers a collection of vintage and industrial original furniture pieces alongside modern design homewares with a Scandinavian influence. Owner Lisa Brass has curated a collection of both the authentically vintage and the beautifully modern.
founder_quote: "We are lucky enough to work with some traditional, authentic workshops and collectors across Europe allowing us to offer some really unique pieces which will last for many many years to come. Alongside this collection, we are thrilled to be working with some of the finest interiors brands in Scandinavia and beyond."

"Other independent business owners inspire us. It's not easy, especially in recent times, and it's constant hard work running your own business, we have so much respect to everyone who is doing their own thing and loving it."
name: Homage
description: Born in London, raised in Brighton. After opening the doors to their first location in Stoke Newington, back in 2011, Homage has since relocated to the seaside and settled into the Seven Dials area of Brighton. The boutique offers a tactile, honest and subtle range of Scandi influenced products including minimalist planters, ceramics and woven baskets. The range reflects owner's Mark and Liza's passion for good design and everyday interiors.

Located in Finsbury Park in London, A Weathered Penny is a fashion and lifestyle store designed with a minimalist aesthetic and founded by Kayleigh. The boutique specialises in jewellery, all of which is designed and handmade by Kayleigh in their north London studio. The edit is characterised by clean lines and distinctive designs and is great for gifting.
name: A Weathered Penny
founder_quote: “I have always had the desire to design and create beautiful products that are affordable and stand the test of time.”

description: An award-winning family business run by boutique founder, Penny Tomlinson's son, Dan Rigby and his wife, Katharine Maclaverty. The Dulwich Trader is a local institution showcasing the best in homewares, fashion and gifts, which has been serving the good people of Dulwich, and further afield, since its doors opened in 1989.
founder_quote: "Dan's mum Penny opened the first shop, the Dulwich Trader, in 1989 when she realised there were no shops locally offering that central London experience of stylish products and a lifestyle mix of home, gift and fashion. We continue to focus on offering an eclectic edit of products with a balance of inspirational style and accessibility."
name: Rigby & Mac
Yards Store
description: Yards is a premium menswear and lifestyle store based in Macclesfield. Established in 2015 by fashion graduates Kyle Gorman & Sam Ffoulkes, their aim is to curate a selection of brands from around the world producing high quality products that celebrate the importance of functionality and design.

name: Bon Tot
description: After becoming a first time parent herself, Bon Tot founder Kristina saw a gap in the market for modern, unisex childrenswear that suited her personal style. Joined in business by husband Graham, together they source ethical clothing and toys from both local and international brands, such as Lennon & Wolf and Maed for Mini. With a focus on delivering a "tough casual" aesthetic with comfort as a top priority, Bon Tot is a destination for well made basics to suit both you and your child's style.
founder_quote: "People love a personal connection, to come and see the product and to be a part of something. As "old fashioned" shopping becomes new again, people will continue to desire this personal touch and tire of the faceless service of the high streets and online. You need both to survive and for them to work together in harmony."

name: Posh Totty Designs
description: Posh Totty Designs, located in Brighton, was set up in 2004 after a trip to Mexico where owner Alice Rivers Cripps was taught the basics of jewellery making by a group of local Mayan jewellers. Setting up in a small shop in Brighton, Alice sold her handmade, hand stamped and personalised jewellery alongside handcrafted gifts sourced from other makers. The brand has grown rapidly and is now a team of 48 split across four boutiques, each of which has its own character. Aiming to build a better relationship with their customers (an area Alice is very passionate about) the team runs classes in ring making, macramé and piñata making.
founder_quote: "Bricks and clicks, we need them both: we want the traditional high street but also the ease of ordering at 10 o clock at night …with Trouva we are able to access the best of all the high streets in one go."

name: East End Prints
description: With a background in photography and publishing, founder Helen Edwards has long been a fan of poster art as an accessible and democratic art form. Based in London's creative hub of Hackney, East End Prints houses a carefully curated collection of designs and collaborations, often working with new and emerging artists locally and across the UK.
founder_quote: "We've been supporting emerging artists since 2010 and we take pride in running a fair creative business. The future of retail for us is all about collaboration and we are always looking for new ways to collaborate with the emerging London art scene."

name: Butlers Emporium
description: Butler’s Emporium, located in the heart of Hastings Old Town, is an elegant homewear and lifestyle boutique run by Rose. Situated in a charming building dating back to 1832, their beautifully curated range features natural materials, quality design and organic ingredients and is displayed across the shop’s old furniture and cabinets.
founder_quote: "I've always sold products that I love and find joy in combining the old and the new."

name: KICKSLOVE
description: Located under Deptford Railway Station, within the newly redeveloped Deptford Market Yard. KICKSLOVE is London's newest female only sneakerhead store.  Founded by Lisa Barlow-Weber, a former buyer and merchandiser for Nike, KICKSLOVE offers the female trainer enthusiast a destination that specialises in exclusive releases, limited editions and unique brand collaborations.
founder_quote: "I am a self-confessed sneakerhead and have been collecting sneakers since I was 16 years old. I wanted to create a store where females could shop the latest and most exclusive sneaker styles in an environment that matched the culture."

name: Lillian Daph Store
description: Inspired by her time studying textiles and high-end design, Lillian Daph founder Christina decided it was time that her beloved home town explored the world of artisan makers. Setting up shop in Saltburn was a natural step after graduating, and Lillian Daph has since become a destination for customers seeking a great shopping experience, with stock being curated from small suppliers and artisan makers.
founder_quote: "I think there is a big force back towards the shopping experience and the artisan. People will be prepared to pay a little more for a well made or well-designed products that will last a lifetime."

name: Little Paperie
description: Little Paperie is an award-winning quirky stationery and lifestyle boutique located in the beautiful market town of Ashbourne on the edge of The Peak District National Park. Little Paperie opened its doors in September 2014 and has since become a haven for stationery lovers near and far.

name: Hare And Wilde
description: Hare & Wilde is a homewares store in Malton, North Yorkshire, co-founded by husband and wife team Laura and Will. Inspired by Scandinavian design, muted colours and simplicity, everything Hare & Wilde sell fits comfortably in an urban interior or a country retreat. They feature brands built on craftsmanship, quality, and their carefully curated collection has been personally hand sourced.

name: Dar Leone
description: Dar Leone is a London based homeware boutique that designs a globally inspired, range of interior, homeware and lifestyle products. Founded by US attorney and Sierra Leonean native, Isatu Funna, Dar Leone is the fulfillment of a long-held passion for African interior design. Inspired by unique treasured finds brought back from Isatu's travels, Dar Leone celebrates the diversity of cultures by seeking out the individual expressions of beauty, craftsmanship and style that come with tradition, heritage and culture.

name: Hall And Co
description: Hall & Co. is home to a beautiful collection of stylish, easy-to-wear clothing and accessories. Run by a mother and daughter team, the boutique opened in the Spring of 2007 and has become a destination for off-duty, timeless classics with a directional edge. The handpicked collection combines simple classic shapes with earthy natural colours and would add an elegant touch to any wardrobe.
founder_quote: A real destination for off duty stylish dressing made easy. Beautiful Italian knitwear, edgy cashmere and perfect jeans - classic neutral colours with pops of seasonal colour.

name: La Portegna
description: La Portegna is a beautiful boutique in Marylebone selling timeless travel accessories, bags and shoes handcrafted in Spain. Passionately inspired by their Iberian roots, they use high quality natural materials to create simple, practical and elegant products.
founder_quote: “At my grandparent’s house there is a magnificent lion rug I have always admired. It was a gift from Ernest Hemingway. When I asked my grandmother how they met, she showed me a photo album of a boat trip between Plymouth and Bombay dated 1933, complete with a signed photo of Hemingway kneeling next to his kill on an African plain. It’s an incredible record of a time when travel was seen as a life experience rather than the quickest way from A to B. The album inspired us to create a collection of travel bags and accessories that recapture that spirit of adventurous travel.”

name: Sefton
description: First opened in Islington, London in 1999 by Ben Eldale and Ben Tidds-Cooper, Sefton aim to provide customers with a distinctly English curation of clean, contemporary and functional garments selected from the very best global brands and designers. Years later their ethos remains unchanged and they have interspersed their own Sefton line of essentials into the product range.

name: A Fly Went By
description: Based in Southwell, Nottinghamshire, A Fly Went By offers a wide range of colourful and quirky items for the home. Stocking brands such as Orla Kiely, Bloomingville and Maileg, A Fly Went By appeals to all ages. Their carefully considered range includes homeware, gifts and stationary in both new and vintage designs.

name: Truce
description: Located in the small Cotswolds town of Nailsworth, Truce opened its doors in August 2016 after owner Chris Williamson found a lack of shops available for him and his wife to experience together. The boutique features a distinctive range of homeware and lifestyle products, sourced from a range of  independent businesses. With a focus on exceeding customer expectations, Chris aims to continually improve what he is able to offer customers: being met at the door by Luna the Dalmatian puppy, a recent addition to the shop floor, is just one example.
founder_quote: "A retailer's responsibility to the customer is to provide the best value and service both in store and online, and it is those that will thrive in the coming years."

name: Frontiers Boutique
description: Frontiers is a well known Edinburgh Boutique which opened its doors more than 20 years ago and for the past five has been run by mother and daughter team Jane and Kim. Jane, founder of Frontiers and a knitwear designer herself, has many years experience in the fashion industry. The pair are always on the look-out for outstanding design and manufacturing of the highest quality. Their beautiful collection of fashion and accessories are housed effortlessly in a charming glass fronted shop situated in Edinburgh's West End.

name: Our Kid
description: Our Kid is an award-winning kids concept store with a cafe in the Manchester suburb of Chorlton. They are 3 mums; Kate, Laura and Tess who believe passionately in sourcing unique, independent brands that reflect cooler side of family life. They are exclusive stockists of Scamp & Dude in the North West alongside labels of the moment Mere Soeur, Tobias and the Bear, Organic Zoo, The Bright Company and Mama Designs. Their cafe, serving locally roasted coffee and homemade cake, is key to creating a laid-back, social atmosphere that both parents and kids can enjoy whilst browsing the collection.
founder_quote: "Our Kid is an award-winning retail experience with a unique social element that attracts style-aware families in search of fashion-forward clothing, gifts and interior accessories. We stock some of the most iconic kid and mum brands in the UK and delight in getting to know our customers over locally-roasted coffee and cake. Stop by and see us soon!" Kate, Laura and Tess - Founders of Our Kid, Manchester

name: Life Story
description: With her distinct vision of contemporary living, the owner Susan Doherty has created welcoming store that offers beautifully made lifestyle products; useful items that contribute to a life lived well. Coffee meets design at this concept store based in Edinburgh complete with an in store cafe alongside their selection of Scandinavian, minimalist design and lifestyle products.
founder_quote: "My inspiration was to bring to Edinburgh the kind of store that I seek out when abroad, an inspiring place where you feel just at home with a coffee flicking through our magazines as you might be shopping for a unique gift."

name: Keishi Jewellery
description: Keishi Jewellery combines semi-precious and precious pieces from local, national and international designers. Their core collection is comprised of classic pieces that continue to feature alongside exciting new items that complement the seasonal focus and trends.

name: Frank
description: Frank was founded in 2006 and resides in an old fisherman’s cottage in Whitstable. Both a store and a gallery, the focus is on paper - contemporary prints, books, journals and sustainable stationery alongside handmade tableware, planters and jewellery, where possible, made in the UK. The collection reflects a passion for the handmade and the artisanal, with a focus on small brands, individual makers and sustainability.
founder_quote: Whether it’s black clay ceramic houses inspired by abandoned Hebridean crofts, or raw honey collected from beehives on London rooftops, it is the stories behind the objects that serves as our inspiration.

name: Winston's Of York
description: Winston's of York is a premium men's clothing and footwear boutique located in York. They pair beautiful products with a personal and engaging approach to selling, achieving a shopping experience that cannot be matched.
founder_quote: A great destination shop in the heart of the beautiful city of York. Come and pay us a visit and take in the sights of the wonderful medieval city.

name: Object & Line
description: Object & Line, which launched in 2010, offers a vibrant range of contemporary, design-led products. Owners Jill and Barry Hepton source their products from companies based in the UK and further afield, and are passionate about finding brands with high design values. Based in Lincoln, they're surrounded by a small community of independents, which includes their sister shop, Bailgate Deli.
founder_quote: Our interest is contemporary design — the clean, well wrought, carefully considered approach to design that's been valued in Europe for the last century. We search out small to medium companies worldwide that have high design values.

name: Blabar
description: Blåbär is a New Nordic concept store and cafe located in South West London. They have handpicked a select range of homeware, lighting and furniture from up and coming Nordic designers, as well as vintage items from Sweden and products from Blåbärs own collection. The space in Putney is also home to their cafe where they serve award winning Swedish coffee, a range of pastries including cinnamon buns and a brilliant brunch.
founder_quote: "We believe that creating a community hub is so important in reviving the high streets - where boutiques become a place for inspiration, new experiences & human connection. Our mission in one word can probably be explained as living "lagom"; This Swedish word loosely translated means not too much, not too little - just right."

name: Cara
description: Cara first opened its doors in Cheltenham and Bristol in 1986 after trading under Midas Shoes and the Turner Brothers name since the late 1800’s. It has since grown into innovative lifestyle brand with an online shop and several stores in the South of England. The skill and experience in creating women’s shoes over the years has led Cara to produce the highest quality collections which are ever evolving with new designs, shapes and finishes.

name: Object Style
description: Object Style is co-founded by husband and wife team, Alex and Rachael Otterwell. Since 2009, the couple have been travelling the world together, piecing together a collection resulting in a beautiful neighbourhood boutique for the local people of Manchester. Working with directional brands built on craftsmanship, quality and simplicity, the carefully curated collection of menswear, womenswear and objects for the home, have been personally hand-sourced by the duo.
founder_quote: "We love nothing more than seeing the genuine delight on people’s faces when they see products in our store and knowing it’s probably not something they’ve seen before, then we know we've done our jobs."

name: Duck Duck Goose
description: A concept store offering curated fashion for creative children; quality clothes, footwear and lifestyle products for ages 0-7. Discover the boutique in the heart of Melbourne, South Derbyshire and find distinctive designs that enable children to express their true spirit and style. Founded by lifelong friends Amy and Jess, both from the fashion world, the boutique offers a stylish range for children - just what you'd imagine from a former print designer and fashion designer.
founder_quote:
A concept store offering curated fashion for creative children; quality clothes, footwear and lifestyle products for ages 0-7. Visit us in our store in the heart of Melbourne, South Derbyshire to discover distinctive designs that will enable your child to express their true spirit and style.

1982, a good year for us and where our tale begins. It was the year we met as teeny 2 and a half year olds and where the Duck Duck Goose story began. We are Amy and Jess, bonded over a mutual love of handstands, bicycle adventures and dressing up. Many journeys later, we are sort of grown-ups with little people of our own to dress. Both from the world of fashion, a print designer and fashion designer respectively, we sought to collate our ultimate children's wardrobe - the concept and online store that is now Duck Duck Goose.

We are qualified members of the Society of Shoe Fitters, offering a complimentary footwear fitting service instore to nurture growing feet, from first steps to school and beyond.

name: Wild and Gorgeous
description: Wild & Gorgeous creates beautiful, design led clothes for gorgeous girls and wild boys and has evolved out of established girlswear brand ilovegorgeous. Launching in September 2016, Wild & Gorgeous is designed by Lucy Enfield and Sophie Worthington.

name: iyouall
description: Based in Deptford, South London, iyouall offers a considered collection of products with simplicity, quality, and functionality running through its core. The boutique was set up by the iya studio which has been at the forefront of creative design for over 10 years. They work with individuals and brands, both start up and global, to develop ideas and identities across the physical and digital worlds. To follow this philosophy, the boutique's products are sourced from local designers and makers, along with global brands, to offer a curated selection for those with an eye for design.

name: Notsobig
description: Located just a stone's throw away from Highgate's Waterlow Park, Notsobig is a colourful and eclectic kidswear boutique. Parents and children will be delighted by the carefully curated product selection, which ranges from traditional children's cashmere and soft cotton t-shirts to fun and educational toys.
founder_quote: We pride ourselves on our 7 star service - we would like our customers to expect a caring touch and personal approach whether they're looking for a first shoe or a whole season's wardrobe.

name: Elegant Atelier
description: Elegant Atelier are a fashion boutique passionate about classic tailoring presented in a contemporary way.  Atelier, meaning an artisan's workshop or studio, epitomises the boutique's philosophy of sharing collections which are expressive, creative and authentic. Their collection offers clothes with exquisite details, soft geometries with vintage suggestions and clean fabrics mixed with embellishments and contrasting prints.

name: & Blanc Fashion
description: Through a unique combination of fashion, clothing, hair styling and coffee, & Blanc Fashion aims to provide customers with a retail experience which they will never forget. After teaming up with 'Evoke Creative Hair', the boutique strives to bridge the gap between hair styling and fashion. This innovative Concept store enables customers to shop the best premium men's fashion brands, relax over coffee and follow the latest hair trends within one urban and rustic retail space.

name: Victoria met Albert
description: Founded by English-German couple Will & Ilka, Victoria Met Albert is the culmination of two cultures and a love of design. Following successful careers as graphic designers in both London and Berlin, the couple were looking for a new challenge. Inspired by a family history of retailers, Will was keen to forge a path that allowed him to meet new people whilst keeping his love for design. Victoria Met Albert has since become a destination within the community, known for stocking under-the-radar brands and design-led products.
founder_quote: "Being from a family of retailers trading for over 25 years, I have learnt how to look at and choose products. There is no set process. sometimes we know our customers will love it whereas other times we just love it ourselves so much that we go for it and hope our customers love it too. This guarantees an interesting variety in the selection and it makes the whole business so much more fun."

name: Closet & Botts
description: Closet & Botts is a homeware store bringing together a range of carefully selected goods both old and new. A love of colour and classic design has led the owners, Harriet and Chloe, to discover the flea markets of Europe, which they scour for vintage treasures to bring home. These form an integral part of the collection alongside new and handmade items chosen for their timeless design.

name: The Hen House
description: Based in the Nottinghamshire town of Southwell, The Hen House opened in May 2001 and are passionate about products for the home and garden which are as beautiful as they are practical. Their products are made from high quality, often natural materials and will add a rustic touch to any space.

founder_quote: Snowden Flood is an interior accessories designer based in a studio/shop on the River Thames in London's Oxo Tower Wharf. She studied Fine Art and then did a masters in sculpture in NY. She is inspired by many different things but is particularly keen on souvenirs and keepsakes.
name: Snowden Flood
description: Snowden Flood is a London-based designer of tableware, gifts, accessories and souvenirs.  Her shop is based on the River Thames in the creative hub of the OXO Tower. Inspiration comes in many forms for Snowden, but a lot of her work is based around souvenirs and keepsakes.

name: ZT
description:
The Zara Taylor Jewellery brand began with Zara’s passion for vintage materials. Her aim is to create quirky pieces that reflect the personality of the wearer. Zara finds inspiration at vintage markets, where she hunts for one-off treasures and trinkets to use in her collections. Each piece is made using high quality, long lasting materials, resulting in a charming and unique feel - like an heirloom.

Launched in 2010, Zara’s quirky, vintage and on-trend designs have quickly become a hit with celebrities like Fearne Cotton, Kelly Rowland, Jessie J, Taylor Swift and Tulisa Contostavlos. In just over two years Zara Taylor Jewellery has been featured in magazines from ‘Look’ to ‘Vogue’, on fashion blogs like Chiara Ferragni’s ‘The Blonde Salad’ and on TV shows ‘The X Factor’, ‘Made In Chelsea’ and ‘Big Brother’.
founder_quote: The Zara Taylor Jewellery brand began with Zara’s passion for vintage materials. Her aim is to create quirky pieces that reflect the personality of the wearer. Zara finds inspiration at vintage markets, where she hunts for one-off treasures and trinkets to use in her collections. Each piece is made using high quality, long lasting materials, resulting in a charming and unique feel - like an heirloom.

name: Wyld Home
description: Based in Shrewsbury, Wyld Home is the vision of founders Krystyna and Paul who set out to create a boutique that was different, bold and full of quality product. After discovering the wonders of organic, natural botanicals and faux flowers, the boutique grew to become a destination for local product and unusual design.
founder_quote: "I love that a lot of our customers think we are a real florist when they walk in. We carefully curate our selection and this shows that my preoccupation with quality is paying off."

name: Otto
description: Otto is a beautiful homeware and gift boutique, launched by interiors stylist and author Liz Bauwens. With plenty of experience in interior styling, having written six books on style and interiors and worked for House & Garden, Good Housekeeping and Country Home magazines, Liz understands the art of curation. Her collection ranges from new and vintage homeware, glassware and ceramics, many of which are sourced from flea markets in the UK and brocantes in France. As a result, Otto is filled with vintage items and one-off, artisanal pieces, making the range truly unique.
founder_quote: I love homewares & interiors, it has been a total pleasure to fill this shop with a complete mix of beautiful things.

name: Win and Ruby
description: Win and Ruby is focused on promoting local, UK and internationally renowned designers and fits beautifully into its location at Deptford Market Yard, home to a community of independent businesses. With years of retail experience, owner Becki’s exceptional understanding of product curation is evident through her elegant collection of lifestyle products which includes home accessories and gifts.

name: Eastern Biological
description: Located on Hackney Road and founded by Alfred Addis, Eastern Biological is a gift and lifestyle store focused on natural history, inspired by places and spaces around the world dedicated to Darwinism.  A botanical and zoological haven, the shop's aesthetic takes inspiration from the Galápagos Islands, the land Charles Darwin famously explored in 1835. Instead of eccentric Victorian curiosities, expect a beautifully curated selection of books, design-led gifts, stationery, educational toys and screen prints, personally commissioned by owner Alf.
founder_quote: "I think the customers who spend a great deal of time in the shop are curious people who love to learn, and are enthused by unusual facts. The shop brings out the inner-child in a lot of people."

name: Parasol
description: Peter Lydon, who has a passion for travel, opened Parasol in 2016 in Manchester's Alderley Edge to curate a selection of goods with the modern traveller in mind. Sourcing everything from sunglasses to swimwear and clothing from a collection of popular brands, Parasol offers holiday makers a one-stop-shop for all their travel needs.
founder_quote: “Looking to the future of retail, I think that bricks-and-mortar shops will always play a role as the result of a continued desire for customers to see products before purchasing.”

name: Jolie a Pied
description: Jolie a Pied, based in East Dulwich, South London, are a footwear specialist with an eye for quality and design. They stock a range of popular brands such as UGG, Converse and TOMS and cater for men, women and children.

OTHER/shop was founded in 2012 by former b store directors Matthew Murphy and Kirk Beattie.

OTHER/shop is London's premier space for contemporary design, art and fashion. After launching our store and establishing a community at Kingly street, we continue to move OTHER/shop forward and have relocated our flag ship store to a new location. With a newly designed store spread over 2 floors and located in the heart of vibrant SOHO, OTHER/shop’s new home sits pride of place on the historical market street, BERWICK STREET. An institution and integral part of the character of SOHO the area has been invigorated by the arrival of independents alike

Independence is at the heart of OTHER/shop, supporting and nourishing young, emerging talent is our primary motivation. Our ethos is to continually look for graduate collections that shine above the rest, while bringing a selection of established labels that share our vision into the mix and onto the shop floor.

A personal service, human touch and attention to detail are just some of the aspects of OTHER/shop that set it apart. From the moment you visit, you'll feel a part of the OTHER/family.
founder_quote: Independence is at the heart of OTHER/shop, supporting and nourishing young, emerging talent is our primary motivation. Our ethos is to continually look for graduate collections that shine above the rest, while bringing a selection of established labels that share our vision into the mix and onto the shop floor.
name: Other Shop

founder_quote: At Freight, we work to design and use materials that are carefully sourced and considered to ensure we are manufacturing items which are going to last well and wear even better. The aim is that a Freight household item will be used repeatedly with no reason to consider an alternative. Freight endeavours to work with manufacturers within the United Kingdom where ever it is feasible and beneficial to the quality of the final product. We are not about trends and fashions but about production of classic goods which last the test of time regardless of transient fashions and trends.
name: Freight Household Goods
description: Freight works to design and use materials that are carefully sourced and considered to ensure they are manufacturing items which are going to last well and wear even better. Freight endeavours to work with manufacturers within the United Kingdom where ever it is feasible and beneficial to the quality of the final product. With an emphasis on classic, well-made products they are an antidote to mass-produced products and transient trends.

name: Seed
description: Seed is located in Somerset and was established by Sinead Foley to support, nurture and promote new British artists. The boutique features an array of beautiful homewares and accessories from jewellery to candles and ceramics. With a constantly evolving range, Seed champions locally produced products and the team pride themselves in the customer support they are able to offer.
founder_quote: "At Seed we are passionate about working with talented British artists - we provide them with a platform to showcase their products and, in turn, we are able to offer our customers a unique selection of products."

name: Spotty Herberts
description: Spotty Herberts is a shop for children, opened in May 2014, owned and run by good friends and mothers Kate Austin and Emily Ingram. Props and references to our families’ love of the fairground, seaside holidays and trips to the woods make Spotty Herberts a warm and welcoming shop for children aged 0-10 years. They stock playful unisex clothing by British designers such as Tootsa MacGinty, Bob & Blossom, Boys & Girls, Where's That Bear, Dandy Star and The Bonnie Mob, as well as a selection of carefully chosen, randomly presented, simple toys and treasures for pocket money purchases, birthday gifts and treats.
founder_quote: Discover our shop, showcasing an adventure in childhood where innocence and magic are alive and playfulness goes hand-in-hand with rainbow badges and fizzy sherbet sticks.

name: Earth Mother Soul Sister
description: A beautifully curated retail and treatment space, Earth Mother Soul Sister combines organic living with a contemporary design aesthetic. Sisters Rachel and Joanna are passionate about organic, beautiful and highly effective health and beauty products and have a lot of experience in the industry. Whilst Rachel is a facialist and has extensive holistic treatment experience, Joanna’s background is in holistic therapies, reiki and fine art, her paintings used on their product packaging. They’re both trained aromatherapists and have studied natural perfumery. They pride themselves on the advice they are able to give to customers and their ability to offer natural solutions for a wide range of concerns.
founder_quote: The years of being on the ‘shop floor’ have given us invaluable insights into what customers want, need and expect from their skin care products. The ongoing conversation with our lovely clients has helped inform us at every phase of the development process of our own range.

name: Brok
description: Located in Shrewsbury, Brok is run by Lloyd Stafford who, after twenty years experience in retail management, decided to fulfill his dream of setting up an independent footwear store for men. With time, the store has evolved into a menswear retailer and now specialises in classic and contemporary men's clothing, footwear and accessories. Stocking a broad range of brands which suit a wide demographic, including Selected Homme, Hymn London and Sandqvist, the boutique is a go-to destination for the style-savvy man.

name: Article
description: Situated on an artsy pedestrian street in the heart of historic Bath,  Article features an expertly-curated selection of quality products, sourced from makers across the UK and some small firms from Europe. Their range includes homeware and stationery products inspired by nature and Article's own range of handmade candles crafted from a unique blend of essential oil scents. The boutique also has a 'scent studio', which specialises in locally-grown and rare varieties of plants and scented flowers.
founder_quote: Situated in an arty pedestrian street in the heart of historic Bath,  my shop sells my own careful selection of British-made products, centred around nature-inspired illustrative design and across homewares and stationery; this could be anything from a botanical design on a textile or porcelain vase, to one of my own handmade candles with my blend of essential oil scents. We also have a 'scent studio' in the shop, where we specialise in locally-grown, rare varieties of plants and scented flowers, and we are an official stockist of David Austin roses.

name: Kestin Hare
description: Kestin Hare is a contemporary menswear brand, established by Kestin in Edinburgh in 2014, which now has a flagship store in Shoreditch, London. After 15 years of experience in the industry, Kestin set about designing his own label. Each collection is built upon the principles of contemporary design and quality materials and is inspired by a different theme. These have included the British outdoor swimming culture and a summer road trip around the northern tip of Scotland.

name: Wattle & Daub
description: Combining the old and the new, Wattle and Daub is a charming boutique set in Godalming in Surrey and run by Gemma. Filled with artisanal crafts and botanicals, including ceramics, original artwork, textiles and homewares, the boutique offers an array of products to transform an interior space into one less ordinary. Gemma sources her products from local artists, makers and larger brands and combines these with vintage one-off finds. Alongside the retail space, Gemma also offers workshops and a bespoke faux flower service where arrangements are designed for each customer.

name: Osmology
description: Founded by Elizabeth Drew as a place to sell her handmade leather goods, Osmology naturally progressed to focus on her other passion, specialist home scents and candles. Now a destination for customers seeking hand-poured, quality scents, Elizabeth is careful to select brands that only pour small batches to ensure this is never compromised. Osmology is a curated collection of the best of candles alongside often handmade or UK sourced lifestyle products.
founder_quote: "I really love the joy customers express when discovering our candles - you hear all sorts of amazing personal stories as the scents trigger people's memories. I am so inspired by our brands, who put so much creativity and imagination into their fragrance."

name: The Clementine
description: The Clementine is a lifestyle boutique based in Cornwall inspired by coastal landscapes and nature. They have a passion for great design and many products are designed and made in Britain. Their range includes a beautiful collection of elemental prints, candles in citrus and fruity notes and luxury women's clothing.
founder_quote: “In the future, I think that more and more of us will seek original and distinctive products for our homes and to give as gifts and I believe that’s where the small independent shops can truly shine.”

name: ALC
description: Located in a listed building on the edge of Edinburgh’s New Town, ALC, founded by Adele Louise Crombie, features an expertly curated collection of denim for women alongside other contemporary clothing and accessories. With experience in fashion retail, Adele opened ALC with a desire to remove the stresses of shopping for denim, created by the overwhelming range on the market. By curating the best denim on offer, Adele enables her customers to find great fitting jeans easily, in a relaxing and supportive environment.
founder_quote: "I'm always inspired by the creativity and drive of other independent business owners - there is such a community feel in my local area with great support from other retailers on offer."

name: My Small World
founder_quote: Founded 12 years ago, My Small World was one of the very first boutique toy stores for children, and has become famous as a true destination for those seeking unique, exciting, handpicked and innovative toys and games for children. We inspire families to play and discover together, so come and visit and re-discover your inner child...!
description: Following a simple philosophy - to inspire and educate children and ignite their imaginations - My Small World, located in Bath and founded by Dawn Burden, is a charming children’s boutique with a huge array of toys. After working to create fun environments for her children to play in, Dawn was inspired to open a toy store designed to elicit gasps of pleasure from its visitors, adults and children alike. The boutique is an interactive and welcoming retail space with toys displayed for children to play with. It features a mix of traditional and contemporary toys, made from quality materials and with beautiful designs.

name: Nonsense
description: Nonsense, established in 2016 by Jeanette Ramirez and Alex Newton, is a concept store and coffee house featuring contemporary, design-led homeware sourced from around the world. Located in Manchester, the vision was to create a multipurpose space in which the local community could browse beautiful products, meet with friends and take part in workshops and classes in a variety of disciplines.

name: Wallow
description: After being inspired by a favourite boutique as a child, Wallow founder Ruthie Mottram always had a dream to open her own shop. Following a varied career, the chance to open her own boutique in the Sussex village of Alfriston came about. Opening its doors in 2015, Wallow has since become a local destination for lifestyle products, accessories, and gifts.
founder_quote: "I think people love bricks-and-mortar stores, where they can touch and feel, see how products fit together and talk to people who really know and care about the things they are selling.  I also think that people don’t just want convenience, they want a personal service and carefully curated products that aren’t found on the high street."

name: Scarpini
description: Located in Southampton and founded by Joy Foote, Scarpini features a stylish range of seasonal footwear and accessories for women. Inspired by designers who create classic yet contemporary products, Joy opened Scarpini in 2008.  Since then, she has worked hard to develop a beautiful and well made range sourced from a variety of popular and lesser known brands.
founder_quote: “I see the future of retail as a very positive one - I think people are making, and will continue to make, considered purchases and buy quality pieces from bricks-and-mortar shops."

name: Movement Boutique
description: A lifestyle store located in Clifton, Bristol, which opened in 2016, Movement Boutique features a lovingly curated selection of fashion, accessories and homeware sourced by sisters Marcelle and Leah. Passionate about supporting ethical and sustainable labels, the sisters source products from suppliers around the world and also place great importance on providing outstanding customer care.

name: Fox + Feather
description: Fox + Feather is an elegant homeware and clothing boutique located in Bristol. It offers a wide range of products sourced from a selection of brands located around the world. The collection features contemporary designs in a range of colourful prints, quality materials and classic styles.

name: Fink's
description: Fink’s, located near Finsbury Park, London, merges beautiful homeware products with a rustic café serving seasonal British ingredients. Alongside a range of quality produce, from preserves and condiments to sweet treats, they stock products for the home including artisanal chopping boards, quirky books and a beautiful collection of environmentally friendly tableware, made from bamboo and corn powder.

name: Bearsteps Coffee & Cloth
description: Bearsteps Coffee & Cloth is a boutique and cafe based in Shrewsbury run by Delavieje Nahvi. After graduating in 2010 with a degree in fashion design, Delavieje gained experience in design, luxury fashion and business through working in a bridal shop. A trip around Europe with her partner sparked a love for the relaxed, laid back cafe culture in cities such as Berlin and Amsterdam. On her return, Delavieje combined her love of coffee and design and set up Bearsteps Coffee & Cloth with an aim to create a welcoming space for different ages and demographics which offers high quality and design- led products alongside coffee and a place to catch up with friends. Located in a 15th century Tudor building, the décor is kept to a minimal to highlight the shop’s original features and give the shop floor a unique character.
founder_quote: "Inspired by our time travelling around Europe, we wanted to combine our passion for cafe culture and design; to serve great coffee alongside beautiful clothing and accessories." Delavieje, Bearsteps Coffee and Cloth.

name: Jane McIntyre Design
description: Located in Winchester, Hampshire, Jane McIntyre Design showcases an eclectic mix of household wares, elaborate fabrics and unique pieces sourced from around the world. With a background in interior and theatre-set design, founder Jane McIntyre is experienced in creating bold interiors and opened her boutique in 2013 to share this passion with others.
founder_quote: "My experience in theatre gives me the confidence to create a dramatic and ever-changing environment, be it in store or online."

name: Milagros
description: Milagros, located on Columbia Road in London and founded by Tom Bloom and his partner Juliette, is a colourful homeware boutique which celebrates Mexico’s strong identity and bold design taste. The boutique works directly with makers to source hand-made products which combine traditional techniques with contemporary design. Their range features hand-blown glassware, charming ornaments and bright storage baskets.

name: Les 100 Ciels
description: Located in a Grade II listed building in St. Christopher’s Place, Marylebone, Les 100 Ciels is a fashion boutique born from a love of cashmere. The team’s vision is to show that cashmere can be synonymous with forward thinking and innovative yet timeless designs. They strive to deliver high quality, elegant pieces that are staples for every woman’s wardrobe and they inspiration from art, culture, dance and nature when designing their collections.
founder_quote: "In a fast paced industry with evolving technology, we try to strike a balance between the offline and online experience. In the future, we are looking to achieve a seamless merge of in-store experiences with subtle technology."

name: Open by I love Mel
description: Open by I Love Mel is located on the seafront in St Leonards and is run by designer, illustrator and writer, Mel Elliott, founder of the I Love Mel publishing label. Alongside I Love Mel products, such as Mel's range of Colour Me Good pop culture colouring books which have been worldwide best sellers, the store stocks a range of creative books, a carefully curated selection of children’s books, fine art prints and gifts. A large and airy retail space, the store has a coffee and juice bar for customers to relax in as well as a selfie room full of fancy dress pieces.
founder_quote: "Consumers appear to be embracing independent shops, which is great. Shops are using more and more creative methods to entice customers in; long may this trend continue."

name: Reste
description: Reste is an elegant homeware and lifestyle boutique in the seaside town of Hastings, set up by Jacqui Martin. Having run a children’s partyware business for ten years, an industry with a lot of waste and mass-produced products, Jacqui wanted to create a store that reflects a simpler way of life and promotes the idea of buying more wisely. She is passionate about working directly with independent makers and everything at Reste has been crafted by hand or made using traditional processes.
founder_quote: "I only sell products that I know have a story to tell. I like to inform my customers on how the product was made, who made it and where."

name: Beaumont Organic
description: Situated in Manchester’s Northern Quarter, Beaumont Organics was set up by Hannah Beaumont-Laurencia in 2008. A refreshing take on women’s fashion, the brand offers organic clothing alongside artisanal homewares. The collection features classic to contemporary styles crafted from responsibly sourced materials such as cotton, bamboo, linen and wool. Set in a Victorian townhouse, the boutique is a hub for the local community, hosting regular craft and nutrition workshops.
founder_quote: “We’ve used a minimal aesthetic to create a calming atmosphere for customers: every product has its place on the shop floor and we’re careful not to overcrowd the space.”

name: Bonds Hackney
description: Bonds in Hackney is a store, coffee spot, event space and so much more.
