The building is home to fragrance brand Earl of East London's studio, and has allowed the founders Niko Dafkos and Paul Firmin to delve deeper in to the world of shopkeeping. The store stocks a range of carefully curated homeware and lifestyle goods from independent brands and craftspeople with a focus on local talent. Bonds also offers a flexible space for workshops, events and product showcases and launches.
founder_quote: "We don’t believe the high street is dead, in fact quite the opposite, it’s just rapidly changing. The future is about delivering a high-quality experience as well as beautifully displayed products. Shops need to have a narrative that weaves through everything they do, to create a loyal following and build a community of loyal customers who become ambassadors for your shop."

name: PAD Lifestyle
founder_quote: "Stores will have to transform their offering to keep customers' interests as online continues to explode. It's going to be all about 'experiential offerings' and advances in technology and social media will play a big part in delivering this."
description: PAD Lifestyle is a fashion and homeware boutique based in Edinburgh founded by Anna Atwal. Having always been interested in design and running her own business, Anna opened PAD Lifestyle in 2015, transforming a dilapidated newspaper shop into an inviting retail space. Anna’s ‘no rules’ attitude allows fluidity and flexibility  - the team adapt and change their range to maintain interest and intrigue. It is this attitude which has led to PAD’s success which includes recently being nominated as Best Independent Retailer at the I-on Magazine Breakthrough Awards.

Based in the heart of Brighton, England at Home is a bright and colourful collection of gifts and homewares. Founded by husband and wife duo Bob and Therese England, the business is made up of two boutiques across the road from each other. With Therese's experience as a buyer and their passion for design, England at Home is constantly evolving, with products being regularly rotated to ensure customers get the same exciting shopping experience, every time.
founder_quote: "We wanted to create a space that we could fill with beautiful and bold objects, combining our passions for design and experience in retail. We find real joy in updating and refreshing our stock, and seeing our customers enjoy it."
name: England At Home
Love4Lighting
description: Love4Lighting, located in Hampton Hill, Middlesex, features a large collection of lighting and accessories, sourced from a number of popular brands. They offer a range of finishes and styles, from pendant to wall lights, which are suitable for both indoor and outdoor use. With such a wide collection, they have lighting solutions to suit any space, from the contemporary to the traditional.

name: The Method
description: The Method, located in Edinburgh, is a lifestyle store and massage treatment space founded by Jodi and Dan. Wanting to combine their experiences, Jodi having worked as a therapist and Dan in the fashion industry, the pair set out to create a calming space to combat the busy lives of their customers. The boutique combines a clean, modern aesthetic with beautifully crafted lifestyle and homeware products to calm and relax visitors and help bring pleasure to daily routines.
founder_quote: "We see a continued shift towards independent retailers who offer unique products and an experience you can’t replicate on the high street."

name: Sunny Siders
description: Located in Shoreditch in London, Sunny Siders offers a curated collection of Japanese menswear and accessories for the contemporary wardrobe. The range honours a minimalist aesthetic, mixing neutral colour schemes with classic Japanese style and quality materials. The team source their apparel from popular brands including Still By Hand, Fujito and Standard Supply.

name: Atelier 51
description: Atelier 51, located in Brighton, sources and showcases products from independent British artists and makers. Their product range includes ceramics, jewellery, silk accessories and prints often inspired by nature and cultures from around the world. The team are passionate about promoting their makers and host regular events to encourage customers in to the shop and adjacent studios. In doing so, makers are able to showcase their work in person and provide customers with an insight into how they create their pieces.

name: Tales on Moon Lane
description: Located in Herne Hill in London, Tales on Moon Lane is a colourful children’s bookshop founded by Tamara Macfarlane. A children’s author herself, Tamara is passionate about children’s literature and its ability to inspire young minds. She runs regular events to engage the local community including in-store talks, readings and school visits.
founder_quote: “We love seeing children’s faces light up as they meet the characters who live on our book shelves. We want to engage our local community and run regular events to encourage this.”

name: Sarah & Bendrix
description: Originally run from owner Veronika's kitchen, Sarah & Bendrix has since opened its doors in Cheam, Surrey. The boutique offers a varied mix of products from quality leather accessories to characterful toys for children. Alongside their own brand, the team are keen to promote other small independent makers who champion classic and functional design.

name: The Modern Draper
description: The Modern Draper is a fashion and lifestyle boutique located in Beverley and founded by Chris Terry and partner Lisa. The boutique stocks an extensive range of premium apparel, footwear and accessory brands sourced from around the world. Whilst initially focusing on men’s and unisex products, they plan to introduce womenswear and homewares in the future. Keen to promote a relaxed shopping experience, the pair offer customers a complimentary coffee upon arrival which they source locally.
founder_quote: “Lisa and I are not just retailers. We are part of the community and we want people to feel welcome and excited by what we offer. And that extends to our online community too.”

name: Kirei Clothing
description: Kirei, meaning 'beautiful' in Japanese, is a clothing studio based in Notting Hill, founded by Hina Moss. Each piece is elegantly made with natural fabrics and vintage inspired laces and trims. The collections combine a rich array of embroideries and beading patterns inspired by textiles and artwork from across the world making each item individual and distinctive.

name: Radiance
description: Now run by her daughter Ffion Atkinson, Radiance was opened in 2005 by designer and maker Hannah Nunn as a glowing celebration of craft and designer lighting. Situated in the heart of northern market town Hebden Bridge, Radiance features lamps, shades, stationery and gifts sourced from a range of artists alongside Hannah's own range of botanical paper cut table lamps, fabrics and wallpapers inspired by the simplicity of the natural world.
founder_quote: “The beauty of selling handmade products made by independent designers is that each item has a story which I love to share with customers. Building genuine and positive relationships with suppliers and customers is so important.”

name: Exclusive Roots
description: Exclusive Roots, located in Oxford, is the trading arm of the UK registered charity Tabeisa which supports the development of small businesses and social enterprises in African communities. They source Fairtrade products including handcrafted jewellery and handwoven baskets from Ghana, Kenya and Senegal. From brightly coloured bags to woven planters, each unique basket is made from natural materials and using traditional techniques.

name: Collard Manson
description: Located in Sheffield, Collard Manson showcases a collection of fashion and accessories sourced by owners Zara and Tim Collard. The pair opened the boutique in 2002 with an aim to replicate in Sheffield the product offering in metropolitan cities such as London, New York and Paris. In order to create atmosphere, they located the boutique in an old property in the heart of the city, restoring the floorboards and keeping the brickwork exposed. The retail space is ever changing, showcasing regular collaborations with different designers. It has also played host to a music pop up shop, maintaining a fluid space to create interest for customers and encourage repeat visits.
founder_quote: "I predict that the future retail landscape will offer a combination of websites and beautiful, inspirational bricks-and-mortar stores. Each shop will play host to exciting events and collaborations and promote themselves across social media."

name: Wanderlust Life
description: Wanderlust Life, located in Ilfracombe, North Devon, showcases an elegant collection of understated and minimal jewellery, made in the UK and inspired by a love of travel. The range features semi-precious faceted jewels and stones which are sourced from around the world and evoke popular travel destinations, from the rich blues of the Mediterranean Sea to the earthy reds of an African landscape.

name: Indigo & Wills
description: Indigo & Wills, located in Bath, features an elegant collection of homeware products which are designed and created in-house by founders William and Angie Fergusson and their dedicated team. Whilst living in India, the pair began designing and printing their own fabric collection using a selection of artisan techniques. They have continued to develop their collection over the past five years, placing emphasis on layers of texture, colour and print techniques inspired by the Mediterranean and the East.
founder_quote: “We see the future of retail as being focused towards customisation – customers will desire products that suit specific colour and design tastes.”

name: homeArama
description: Formed over 10 years ago by friends Mike and Caroline, homeArama is a treasure trove filled with a variety of design-led goods for your home. Housed in a former RAF building, their collection is wide in its variety, use and style but each object is linked by fundamental principles of quality, design, beauty, functionality and durability, offering the best of their type.
founder_quote: "Family and community values are key to us and our goal is to find like-minded ethical family businesses from around the globe whose products suit the daily needs of our customers. Many products are unique, or almost unique, to us in the UK!"

name: The Deco Shop
description: The Deco Shop is located in Machynlleth in the heart of rural Wales and is run by Camilla Norberg. Offering an eclectic product range comprised of British and Scandinavian design, the team are passionate about modern country style in all forms, from cabin to manor house. They also run an interior design service alongside a showroom which is situated locally to the shop.
founder_quote: "I'm Swedish so Scandi style is ingrained, but I love the rich history of British design. I think something interesting happens when the two come together. Our shop is organised, but definitely not minimalist. You'll always find something new."

name: Bare Organics
description: Bare Organics, located in York, features a premium collection of baby and childrenswear sourced from a range of distinctive brands. Founder Elle McManaman was inspired by her travels and the unique finds that independent boutiques can offer and in November 2015 Bare Organics opened their doors. Sourcing ethical and organic products is a big part of their ethos and their products are made from fibres that are gentle on the skin.
founder_quote: "I hope that the pieces that I carefully select are passed down for generations with great stories to tell that all started at Bare. I think the way retail is heading is towards a growth of independents and an awareness of ethically sourced product that has a quality the high street can't offer."

name: AS Apothecary
description: AS Apothecary, located in Lewes, offers a premium range of beauty products which are crafted in-house by founder Amanda Saurin and her dedicated team of women. Pivotal to the team’s philosophy is a seed to serum ethos; the team grow, gather, distil and make their products on site. They feel that through this care and attention to detail, the true essence and vitality of their plants can be captured in their products. Committed to sharing their story with their customers, the team also invite locals into the shop to help pick the petals from flowers during the busy summer months.
founder_quote: “I wanted the shop to be a creative hub and it is becoming exactly that – during our workshops and meetings we've made natural perfume, soap, terrariums, hats, weavings and so much more.”

name: Caro Somerset
founder_quote: "I’m excited by the spread of independent shops across the country: I predict an increase in the number of boutiques opening up in towns and villages as cities no longer hold the limelight in terms of interesting retail concepts."
description: Located in a charming property in Bruton, Somerset, Caro Somerset is a lifestyle and homeware boutique founded by Natalie Jones. Inspired by the creative environment within Bruton, Natalie exchanged London for a more idyllic setting and drew upon her experience in design, trend forecasting and strategy planning when setting up her boutique. She curates a stunning collection of quality products, from apparel to objects for the home, and enjoys selecting those which encourage everyday luxuries.

Gresham Blake are a unique bespoke tailors situated in the heart of Brighton's famous North Laine.

As well as bespoke tailoring and footwear (U Design GB) you will also find a great selection of ready-to-wear seasonal clothing.

All our items are limited edition and truly cater for the individual who is looking for something fun and a  bit different.
name: Gresham Blake
founder_quote:
Gresham and his wife, Fal, launched the Gresham Blake brand in Brighton at the height of ‘Cool Britannia’ in 2000. Since then, Gresham’s eye-catching creations for high-profile clients including Ray Winstone, Steve Coogan, Jimmy Page, Plan B and Norman Cook (aka Fatboy Slim) have brought him fashion industry recognition and an ever-growing army of customers attracted by his signature combination of quality garments with a quirky twist.

Gresham grew up in Tunbridge Wells, inheriting his needlework skills from his mother, a talented seamstress and art teacher. His mum’s influence on his career direction was evident early – by the age of four he was already using his tailoring skills to create apparel and matching accessories for his Action Man collection. After briefly considering a career as a sculptor, he went on to study fashion at Brighton University, following in the footsteps of former alumni, Barbara Hulanicki.

name: The Restoration
description: Located in Stoke Newington, London, The Restoration features an array of quality products for the home and is founded by Sophie Jones and Spud MacBain. Stocking everything from clocks to quirky prints and classic items for the kitchen, the boutique has become a go-to destination for home accessories with products to suit a range of interior styles, from the contemporary to the traditional.

name: Car and Kitchen
description: Opened in 1976 by current owner Henry Meredith’s grandparents, Car and Kitchen, located in Settle, North Yorkshire, is a family-run business offering a wide range of quality products alongside an in-house café. Originally a garage, the shop has developed over the years and now stocks everything from kitchen and homeware to clothing and stationary, sourced by Henry and his wife Natasha.
founder_quote: "We think there’s going to be a shift towards savvier independents selling better quality and more interesting products."

name: Kobi & Teal
description: Located in Frome in Somerset, Kobi & Teal was founded by designers Nick Fraser and Polly Bell. The pair curate a characterful array of handmade items, many of which are crafted from traditional techniques. Passionate about promoting small brands and independent makers, they regularly hold exhibitions in their on-site gallery. These provide an opportunity for artists to share their wears with customers in a relaxed setting.
founder_quote: “In our view, the community of independent retailers will continue to grow. They will allow customers to access distinctive and lasting products which will challenge our throw away culture.”

name: Scottie & Russell
founder_quote: "For me, there is nothing quite like browsing independent bricks-and-mortar shops. The high street would be lost without them!"
description: Located in Windermere, Scottie & Russell was founded by Lucy Bee and features a premium range of baby and homeware products. Lucy has her own range of luxury fragranced candles, homeware, clothes and baby gifts alongside handpicked pieces from other brands. Initially an online business, she opened her bricks-and-mortar shop in the heart of the Lake District to enable her to meet and engage with customers.

name: Homefront Interiors
description: After falling in love with an empty shop located in Bath, Vanessa Clark opened Homefront Interiors as a destination for artisanal homewares. She is passionate about sourcing handmade products from makers, based both locally and around the world, which she curates alongside vintage finds. Stocking a wide range of items from rustic frames to baskets and room décor, her boutique has become a popular spot for locals to find those all-important finishing touches for the home.
founder_quote: “I am thrilled to be part of the Trouva community - it gives me another shopfront and enables customers who don’t live in close proximity to the physical store to browse and shop my products.”

name: Fishboy PZ
description: Penzance based Fishboy PZ is run by Izzy Philips and Mat McIvor who curate a considered collection of fashion for the contemporary wardrobe. They source their products from an exciting collection of brands alongside their own range. Inspired by the Cornish traditions of farming, fishing and mining, the Fishboy PZ collection is screen-printed on site by Mat.
founder_quote: “We feel that whilst shopping habits have changed with the advances in technology, there seems to be a surge in independent boutiques coming onto the high street.”

name: Leamington Collective
description: Leamington Collective was founded by Carine Harrington and Liz Downton and is located in Leamington Spa. The boutique offers an eclectic selection of products for the home, from distinctive room décor to sheepskin rugs. With experience in interior design and retail, the pair love finding inspirational new product ranges to showcase and share with their customers.
founder_quote: "We love talking to customers and helping them with any interior design projects or queries they have."

name: Charlene Mullen
description:
Charlene creates unique embroidered textiles mixing traditional techniques with her love of the drawn line. The end product -  cushions, throws and lampshades are suitable for residential and commercial projects. Drawing on a wide range of inspiration such as Swiss paper cuts, Stig Lindberg's ceramics, Blackwork, scientific structures, tribal costumes, Gee Bend quilts, she works with master craftsmen in India so each piece is beautifully hand embroidered using tapestry wool to ensure shade, colour fastness and durability.

The studio is committed to original design and making quality products. In addition to the collection Charlene provides a commissioning service working with private clients, interior designers and architects to create bespoke projects both in the U.K. and worldwide.

Dowse is an art studio and shop showcasing their own range of design-led products alongside that of other like-minded small brands and creatives.  Believing that beauty in an object comes in part from how it's made and by whom, Dowse champions thoughtfully made products that aren't just designed but are also made in Europe.
name: DOWSE
founder_quote: Being able to have a conversation directly with our customers and seeing how they respond to our designs is the best thing about our studio & shop. It’s really interesting to hear people talking about the pieces and what we learn from a little bit of eavesdropping helps guide our new designs.

name: Stighlorgan
founder_quote: "Stighlorgan is for the long road we all travel."
description: Located in Hackney, Stighlorgan is a modern accessories brand who’s aesthetic sits between American utility and European minimalism. Specialising in backpacks, they are passionate about servicing the requirements of travel, whether for the daily commute or longer trips. The London boutique is a showcase of their full collection and combines versatile and functional accessories with men’s and women’s apparel.

name: Nola
description: Brighton-based boutique Nola is run by Rhonda Cook who noticed a gap in the market for design-led womenswear without high-end prices. A mix of classic, feminine styles, retro prints and bold motifs, the collection is sourced from brands including Selected Femme, Elka and American Vintage.
founder_quote: "Our customers are increasingly interested in the provenance of the clothes they buy. The use of organic and recycled materials and sustainable production techniques matter more and more."

name: Boutique 3
description: Based in Cirencester, Boutique 3 offers refined fashion and accessories for women, sourced and curated by owner Caroline Lait. It features a stunning selection of apparel sourced from popular brands including PS by Paul Smith and AG Jeans. These quality products are beautifully merchandised by the team who are on hand to offer expert fashion advice. As such, the boutique provides a go-to destination for the stylish and contemporary woman.

name: Birdhouse Tea Company
description: Birdhouse Tea Company is a stunning tea house located in Sheffield. It offers an extensive range of teas from traditional flavours to unique collections inspired by areas of Britain, seasonal events and more. Alongside the in store café and shop, they also run workshops for tea enthusiasts.

name: Abigail Ahern
description: Abigail Ahern, set up by Abigail herself, is located in Islington in London and specialises in faux flowers and striking home furnishings. The boutique is full of interesting pieces, many of which are designed by Abigail. Inspired by travel and day-to-day experiences, the collection is full of rich tones and opulent designs, perfect for dramatic interiors.
founder_quote: "The nature of retail is changing with customer experience moving to the fore. At Abigail Ahern we love interacting with our customers and sharing interior inspiration to help them re-imagine their home."

name: minima.
description: Located in the heart of Birmingham, Minima is founded by Bal Malhi. Excited by the harmonious relationship between form and function, Bal curates a collection of minimalist homeware. He sources his products from a range of iconic brands based around the world and aspires to make Minima the destination for contemporary interior pieces.
founder_quote: “We enjoy combining bricks-and-mortar retail with online; the shop enables us to meet customers whilst the website allows those who don’t live locally to access our products.”

name: Beech & Birch
description: Located in Gifford in East Lothian Beech & Birch features quality homeware for the minimalist home. Its dedicated team expertly curate Scandinavian and Nordic gifts and homeware which they source from a range of brands. The collection includes accessories, prints and contemporary vases in an array of pastel hues.

name: Offshore Blooms
description: Situated in Braunton in North Devon, Offshore Blooms is run by owner Kelly. Set in rural surroundings, the homewares and accessories boutique sits alongside a florist, creating a truly inspiring retail space. The homeware range includes concrete lighting, Scandi-inspired tableware and leather purses, and has become a shopping hub for the local community.

name: Piccadilly Lilly
description: Piccadilly Lily is located in Elie in Scotland and is run by Mia Gonzalez-Noda and her partner Sandy. Wanting to improve their work-life balance, the couple moved to Elie to open up the boutique. They curate a beautiful array of homeware and fashion products sourced from talented new makers. The shop also features products made by Sandy himself, which he creates in his workshop.
founder_quote: “Trouva allows small businesses like ourselves to support each other and together support our highstreets. By doing so, we will all be able to thrive.”

name: The Kitchen Shop
description: Founded in 1982 by Barry and Hilary Woolston, The Kitchen Shop is a specialist cookware and tableware shop located in the beautiful Cathedral city of Lichfield. This well established shop trades within a three storey Georgian building with a vast selection of cookware on the ground floor and tableware and gifts on the first floor. The founder’s daughters, Vicky and Lizzy run the shop with their friendly and helpful team who are always ready to give expert advice.
founder_quote: "With over 35 years experience, we pride ourselves on our extensive selection of products and our excellent customer service. We love our shop today as much as we did when we first opened our doors all those years ago!"

name: Hook Ldn
description: Hook LDN, founded by Zak Biddu, is located in Shoreditch in London. It features a bold yet elegant collection of eye wear designed in the city and influenced by Zak’s love of music and fashion. The team are passionate about supporting new creative talent and continue to build strong relationships with people working in the music and fashion industries.
founder_quote: “Our products showcase intelligent construction and refined aesthetics. They’re manufactured using contrasting metals and patterned acetates.”

name: Design @ 44
description: Situated in Derby in the heart of the Midlands, Design @ 44 is owned by Jade Devall. With a background in design, Jade opened her boutique to showcase the best of Scandinavian design. She curates a selection of gift and lifestyle products which she sources from independent makers and businesses. The boutique provides a platform from which these makers can sell their wares and also enables Jade to stock unique products.

name: Reef Knots
description: Patrick Dudley-Williams founded Reef Knots with one ambition; to design and produce handmade printed silk ties to remind people of life beyond the corporate grind. All Reef Knots products are inspired by the summer and the ocean and many boast quirky designs of sea creatures. Patrick opened his bricks-and-mortar shop in Leadenhall Market in London in 2015.
founder_quote: "I believe that small retailers with strong brand identities and an online presence have a huge opportunity to grow without the need to have multiple shops or wholesale."

name: Dapper Fox
description: Based in Bury Saint Edmunds, Dapper Fox curates stylish clothing for the modern gentleman and was set up in 2015. It offers a colourful selection of formal attire, from ties to outerwear, and has quickly established itself as a destination for contemporary menswear.

name: Distinctly Living
description: Located in Dartmouth in Devon, Distinctly Living was founded by Giles and Sarah Halliwell. The pair wanted to escape London after the birth of their daughter and moved to Devon to open their boutique. They source a selection of homewares and furniture from across Europe and draw inspiration from the local landscape.
founder_quote: "We feel that we will continue to see a growth in the number of independents on our high streets: customers are seeking quality items and inspiration and it is independent shops who are leading the way ahead of larger retail chains."

name: Catalog Ltd
description: Located in Edinburgh, Catalog Ltd offers interior accessories for the contemporary home sourced by owners Ralf Farthing and Dixie Mirowski. This husband and wife duo curate an array of homewares, from soft furnishings to lighting solutions which they refresh regularly to maintain interest. They run an interior design service alongside their shop and are experts in interior styling and trends.
founder_quote: "Buying online makes everything so accessible and drives competition. This shouldn’t be the death of the high street but instead a new avenue for all businesses to thrive."

name: Reason Interiors
description: Located in Bristol, Reason Interiors is a family-run business, founded by Sue, Louise and Alice Revelle. With a passion for interiors, the trio source products from brands including Bliss Home, Dassie Artisan and Nkuku. They are inspired by characterful homes and country cottages, particularly those found in the Cotswolds.
founder_quote: "We believe that bricks-and-mortar retail will continue to thrive in the coming years as shoppers love visiting physical shops, immersing themselves in the experience and seeing products face to face."

name: Victoria Windsor
description: Victoria Windsor is located in Pimlico in London and is run by Victoria McCubbine. Victoria has a passion for design and has previously worked at prestigious British institutions, Liberty and Burberry. She draws upon this past retail experience when visual merchandising her boutique and sourcing products from independent designers and British and European brands. Her boutique features a range of premium homeware and accessories and is fast becoming a destination for gifting.
founder_quote: “I predict that smaller independents will come into their own in the coming years. Customers are becoming more interested in finding something distinctive and the easier that becomes, the more they will explore.”

name: B the Lifestyle Shop
description: Located in Newbury, B the Lifestyle Shop expresses a minimal aesthetic inspired by Scandinavian design. Owner Emma Bees draws upon past retail experience to expertly merchandise the shop floor, a carefully considered space designed to allow a natural interaction with products. The range includes inspiring products for children, classic womenswear styles and interior accessories.
founder_quote: “I believe that there's great hope for independent boutiques - shoppers desire exceptional customer service and inspiring products, two areas in which independent shops excel.”

name: Mr Mullan's
description: Sleek and stylish, Mr Mullan’s is located in Kingston Upon Thames in Surrey and features grooming products and accessories for the modern gentleman. The team source products from popular brands including Le Labourer, Jollie Socks and Hightide. They also showcase their own brand which is crafted by hand in England from a selection of natural materials.

name: Noble Macmillan
description: Located in Kensington, Noble Macmillan was opened by Tom Dodd Noble and Adam Macmillan. The boutique specialises in leather home accessories and features photo albums, diaries and sporting books, alongside other contemporary items. Whilst they are inspired by new colours, trends and needs when designing their products, the team ensures that a connection to the brand's heritage is always maintained.
founder_quote: “We believe that bricks-and-mortar shops will remain an important part of our high street for years to come: customers will continue to have an interest in the origin of their products and will always enjoying seeing them in their physical form before they buy.”

name: Meggie's
description: Meggies is located in Stow-on-the-Wold in Cheltenham and is run by Megan Ford, who originally opened the boutique inside her family’s hotel in 2014. She has since moved into a larger shop, expanding her range to include products for children, gifting, home interiors, accessories and stationery. Many of the products she sources are handcrafted in The Cotswolds.

name: Junior Edition
description: Located in Brighton, Junior Edition is a family owned children’s boutique which opened in 2015.  It replicates the charm of its local surroundings in its colourful and quirky collection of products for kids. It features clothing, accessories, toys and nursery décor and draws inspiration from fashion, art and design. By doing so, it provides a unique offering and has established itself as a popular haunt for children and parents alike.

name: Noted
description: Situated in the rural Herefordshire town of Leominster, Noted is run by brother and sister team Laura and Paul Healey. The duo compliment each other well, with Paul focusing on e-commerce and Laura taking charge of the in-store merchandising. They hope to create a relaxed and friendly retail environment where customers can browse their stylish collection of womenswear with ease.
founder_quote: “I think we'll see a greater focus on the retail experience in the coming years: people can easily buy products online but to have personality and an experience when they shop will be key.”

name: Little Alligators
description: Little Alligators is located in the Yorkshire town of Harrogate and supplies quality apparel and toys for children. Their range includes charming soft toys, nursery décor and clothing making this boutique the perfect destination for refreshing your little one’s room and wardrobe. With a bright and open shop floor, the boutique is an inviting space for parents and children to explore.

name: Design Museum Shop
description: Located at the Design Museum on Kensington High Street, the Design Museum Shop presents a carefully curated selection of homeware products. The shop reflects the values of the museum itself, with a focus on architecture, fashion, graphics, product and industrial design. Every purchase supports the Design Museum allowing the museum to expand and build on their cutting-edge roster of exhibitions and events.

name: No Guts No Glory
description: Focused on sustainability, No Guts No Glory is located in Exeter and run by Hayley and Nathan Maker who hope to encourage customers to adopt a slower pace of living. The boutique features products sourced from expert artisans, many of whom are inspired by the natural world, alongside frames and t-shirts made in store. The retail space includes an in-house studio and coffee bar, and the team regularly run craft workshops to interact with customers.
founder_quote: "The future of retail is in more conscious consumerism - there will be a focus on buying products that are beautifully and ethically made which will last a lifetime."

name: The Living Lounge
description: The Living Lounge opened in Canterbury in 2016 by owner Leila Appleby-Lansley after a positive response to her three month pop-up shop. After studying Fashion Styling at The London College of Fashion, and a number of years spent as a fashion stylist and visual merchandiser, Leila followed her dream to set up her own shop. She believes that layers of texture are vital in a home, qualities which are hard to express online, and wanted to provide customers with an opportunity to experience beautiful homeware products in their physical form. Her collection is designed to work together cohesively, evolving with the seasons.
founder_quote: "The convenience of online retail means that it will undoubtedly continue to grow but I believe that this will run hand in hand with independent boutiques - places that will inspire you, allow you talk to the owners and makers first hand and receive a personalised service."

name: Fetch & Follow
description: Located in Netil Market in London, Fetch & Follow features a premium collection of products for dogs designed by owners Genesta Gunn and Taneale Hrymakowski. Inspired by the practicalities that come with owning dogs in a fast paced urban city, the pair curate leads, collars and coats for dogs of all sizes drawing upon their own experience in retail buying and design. They use only recycled or biodegradable packaging and all products are manufactured in the UK.
founder_quote: "Customers want to be immersed in a community that they can relate to when they visit a shop which makes this a really exciting time for bricks-and-mortar retail."

name: No 59
description: Located in the traditional market town of Devizes in Wiltshire, No 59 is run by Kevin Stone and his wife Hilly and is the realisation of a lifelong dream. Filled with fittings collected over the last 20 years, the shop is a showcase of timeless design and quality products, each with a story to tell. Whilst Kevin and Hilly’s curated edit is an expression of their own design aesthetic, it also maps closely to the needs of their customers.
founder_quote: "We would like to think that owner-driver concept stores providing great service will play an even bigger part in the future of independent retailing, for us it’s a dream that is worth pursuing."

description: Mother-daughter duo, Cassie and Bev, opened Room 356 in October 2014 with a shared vision for an understated boutique, offering the best homeware and lifestyle products with a pared-back aesthetic.
founder_quote: We see a trend for online retail businesses increasingly looking to complement their online offering by opening physical retail outlets or ‘pop ups'. Physical stores will continue to be more closely synced with customers' need for online shopping too.
name: Room 356
Scandi Living
description: Founded by Swedish national Linda Swarbrick, Scandi Living is a space full of Nordic charm set in the Surrey hills.  After a career in banking, Linda was looking for a new challenge and began her retail journey from her dining table, selling Scandi brands online. After 5 years of building the business online, the perfect space came up in Hindhead village with charming historical features to compliment her products. Stocking a curated blend of contemporary and traditional Scandinavian designs, every item is hand picked by Linda to ensure the best products make the shelves. Serving Swedish cinnamon buns and coffee whilst you browse, Scandi Living is a warm and inviting space to discover homewares and Scandi style.
founder_quote: "My dream was always to have my own shop and now I do. I am so passionate about independent retail and my business - I pretty much live and breathe Scandi Living! I get inspired being around beautiful products and getting to meet my customers, as well as other like minded independent boutique owners."

name: Poppets
description: Mother of two Kate is the driving force behind Poppets, a children's boutique in the heart of Hove. Originally founded in 1979 by Kate's own mum, the boutique is a treasure trove of beautiful, educational toys. Kate constantly draws on her own experience as a mum as well as her background in the creative arts to curate a wide selection of gifts and games from around the world.
founder_quote: We have applied the idea that products should both look great and work great to everything we source at Poppets.

description: With a long career in trading and exporting, German native Marie Harz has had an international journey before settling in her Bristol hometown. After meeting her future British partner in Australia whilst travelling, it was a few years before she made the move to the UK. After relocating to Bristol, she began working in a Chinese antique shop and became inspired by the customers and world of retail. When the shop came up for sale, it was the perfect opportunity to explore her love of design along with her passion for independent retail. Since taking over in 2007, Oskar Furniture has become a destination for European products that are design-led as well as beautiful.
name: Oskar Furniture
founder_quote: "I am constantly inspired by galleries and museums across Europe. I really relate to the Scandinavian aesthetic and way of life and feel that our boutique reflects this ethos, stocking beautiful products that are design with practicality in mind."

name: London Terrariums
description: London Terrariums is located in New Cross in London and is run by Emma Sibley.  It features terrariums, plants, ceramics and gardening accessories, elegantly arranged in a bright and colourful retail space. Emma became fascinated with this intricate craft four years ago and began to run workshops all over the city. Being so popular, the workshops inspired her to open London’s first terrarium boutique.
founder_quote: “The best thing about the boutique is the warmth and vibrancy of its interior. The space is filled with plants and has brightly coloured walls. Customers step from the rowdy Old Kent Road into the calmness of the store.”

name: Salt & Silver Jewellery
description: Salt and Silver Jewellery is located in the seaside town of Cleethorpes in Lincolnshire and is run by Katie Rudd. Passionate about the ocean and the environment, Katie crafts a stunning range of eco friendly jewellery using recycled silver in her onsite workshop. Her products are all packaged in recycled or recyclable packaging and are arranged beautifully to encourage her customers to relax and browse.
founder_quote: "I predict that, whilst retail will have an increasingly online presence, quality independent boutiques will continue to open as shoppers re-discover the beauty of discovering treasures in physical shops: there’s nothing quite like stumbling across a quirky little shop and rummaging around to find something you fall in love with."

name: Ryan James Studio
description: Ryan James is a menswear boutique based in Glasgow and run by James Rennie. With a background in fashion, James set out to curate a collection of menswear focused around style, quality and craftsmanship. Aware of the market's growing interest in the origins of products, James sources items designed and crafted in the UK and shares the stories behind each with customers.
founder_quote: "To keep things interesting, I think retailers need to personalise the customer's in-store experience as well as introducing them to interesting, diverse products."

name: Cissy Wears
description: Cissy Wears is located in Lewisham in London and features an eclectic array of products sourced by owner Nicola Eyre. The boutique offers Nicola the space to showcase design led products for the modern family. She curates premium apparel for women and children which boast charming characters and dusky hues. These sit alongside a collection of quality homeware products from magazines for the coffee table to nursery décor.
founder_quote: “I predict a growing trend for distinctive products coupled with on-demand services and quick delivery times.”

name: 1n1 Fashion n Pizza
description: Located in Aldgate in London, 1n1 Fashion n Pizza is run by Martina Vitali and Andrea Danelli who ingeniously combine delicious pizza with glamorous fashion pieces. Whilst Martina loves uncovering new fashion designers, understanding their inspirations and curating the edit of clothing in store, Andrea is passionate about food and designs the inspiring menu.
founder_quote: "We love the idea that customers visit our boutique to enjoy a slice of pizza and leave with a new pair of sunglasses and vice versa!"

name: Owl & Monkey
description: Founded by Helen and Matt Harris, Owl & Monkey is located in York and offers a beautiful range of homewares to spark joy in the everyday. This husband and wife team had always dreamed of running a 'story book' shop, where a warm welcome is offered and the shelves are filled with inspiring delights. The couple are passionate about supporting the skills of makers and artisans and run regular exhibitions and workshops in the shop.
founder_quote: "Small independents curate selections with provenance and soul and do so in an environment that offers a little magic. As our community takes advantage of online opportunities, we must create an experience that brings just the same joy for customers as visiting a physical shop."

name: Tidy Street General Store
description: Located in bustling Brighton, Tidy Street General Store is jam-packed with a diverse array of delightful products. A one-stop-shop, this boutique offers fashion, homewares and food which is sourced by the team from both well-known and independent brands. Passionate about the customer experience, the team have created an inviting and intriguing retail space, where customers can arrive with a product in mind and leave having unearthed an array of others.

name: Elk & Wolf
description: Located just off Edinburgh's Royal Mile, Elk & Wolf offers an array of bohemian homewares, jewellery and accessories beautifully displayed by the team. Passionate about supporting artisans, they collaborate closely with local artists and makers, displaying their unique products in the shop.

name: Mooch- Ealing
description: Mooch, an award winning boutique based in Northfields, Ealing, offers a beautiful range of quirky and stylish products, from homeware to high quality children's clothing. They are passionate about products inspired by their local surroundings, stocking a range exclusive to them, and love to support up and coming designers.
founder_quote: MOOCH is a real destination for shoppers seeking something out of the ordinary; visit our shop on Northfield Ave in Ealing, West London. You will discover some truly unique designs that will delight any recipient as well and making a gorgeous self purchase. We pride ourselves in stocking quirky and stylish products including a lovely babies and young children's range.  We specialise in local themed products and champion lots of up and coming young designers who make the most wonderful jewellery, prints, bags, toiletries, and much much more. Come and visit us and be inspired by what MOOCH has to offer.

name: Astrid & Miyu
description: Featuring a distinctive range of jewellery, Astrid & Miyu is located in Marylebone, London and is run by Connie Nam. Frustrated by the lack of stylish, affordable jewellery on the market, Connie founded Astrid & Miyu and quickly gained popularity due to her unique range. Originally an online business, opening the bricks-and-mortar shop allowed customers to engage more with the brand. Here they could view the products in person and meet Connie and her team.
founder_quote: “Whilst I find inspiration for my collections in everyday objects and the people around me, it is London that inspires me the most, with its diversity and creative flair.”

name: The Gilded Cabinet
description: A showcase of interesting and unusual homewares and contemporary colours, The Gilded Cabinet is located in Alton and run by Leanne Williams and Boo Craig-Wood. Thanks to previous careers in creative industries, the pair have developed a strong design ethos which is evident in their vibrant mix of products for the home. They are passionate about sharing interior advice with customers and run an interior design studio alongside the shop.
founder_quote: "It's very encouraging to see a growth in the number of independent boutiques along our high streets. They're becoming ever popular as the market moves away from mass-produced products, towards quality and individuality."

name: Toby Tiger
description: We are a childrens wear boutique in Brighton's trendy North Laines area. We aim to put the joy back into kids clothing with our love of bright colours and bold patterns, designed by our founder, Zoe Mellor.
founder_quote: Our children's clothing is bold, sustainable, timeless and high quality. The Toby Tiger philosophy is for kids to be dressed as kids, in our colourful, instantly recognisable prints and motifs.  Our clothing is made to last and to be passed down from generation to generation. Most of our designs are unisex and we know kids love wearing our bold, colourful and comfy clothes.

name: W.A.Green
description: Inspired by California’s carefree and crafty aesthetic, W.A. Green is a showcase of colour and contemporary design. Located in Shoreditch and run by Zoe Anderson who named the shop after her grandfather, this bright boutique presents an edit of homewares from an array of exciting brands including Keith Haring and Atelier Stella. Intrigued by the growing link between fashion and interior trends, Zoe selects products which have close ties to the fashion world with a number sourced from brands with a fashion heritage.
founder_quote: "I think there's always going to be a place for bricks-and-mortar retail though online visibility will be key to ensuring its success."
Shopping for jewellery should be fun and special. We enjoy helping everyone choose - whether it is a  lunch time office collection gift or the most important ring in your life.
description:
Joy Everley Fine Jewellers is a unique family-run, independent boutique specialising in precious metals and natural stones. Every item of jewellery is designed in-house by Joy Everley - the chief designer and founder - with some guest collections designed by friends and family.

Joy creates both ready to wear and bespoke jewellery, always beautiful, unique and precious. Ready to wear designs include Exotic Spices, handpicked Diamonds and an inspiring selection of Silver and Vermeil Charms. They also specialise in Pearl and Wedding jewellery, and Mens Accessories. 

Joy began her journey selling her jewellery in a small stall in Convent Garden Market back in the 1980's. Now she runs her own boutique, which has been firmly established in the Newburgh Quarter just off Carnaby Street for over 17 years... and they're one of the few truly independent shops in the Carnaby Quarter!
name: Joy Everley
D R Harris & Co Ltd
description: Founded in 1790 by Henry Harris and Daniel Rotely, D.R Harris has been offering grooming products for the discerning gentleman for over two hundred years. This specialist boutique is located in St. James’s in London and offers an array of traditional products from shaving creams to aftershaves and grooming accessories. Alongside the retail space, the team also run the oldest pharmacy in the city.

name: The Idle Man
description: Starting life as an online brand designed to help men to dress, look and feel better, The Idle Man first opened its doors as a bricks-and-mortar shop in October 2016. Disillusioned by the high street options available for men, founders Alex Outlaw and Oliver Tezcan set out to create a destination that champions style over fashion, offering guidance, style tips and inspiration. With an expert team dedicated to providing advice and service, The Idle Man is home to their own line of clothing and accessories alongside big name brands such as YMC and Redwing.
founder_quote: "The natural progression from our website was to create a physical embodiment of our brand with our first shop. It’s a place where customers can actually feel and try on the products whilst being guided by our in-house stylists on what suits their build and size."

name: T&SHOP
description: Located in the heart of Stoke Newington, T&Shop was born as a result of the owner Emily's love of tea combined with her passion for design. A former visual merchandiser and stylist who was brought up holistically, it was always Emily's dream to open her own boutique. The boutique has a homespun quality with Emily handling everything, from brewing tea for customers to going on buying trips to Europe.
founder_quote: "The community in Stoke Newington is particularly special and my customers really make my day. Lots of them are friends and I know them so well. I hold their kids and play with them outside; I even taught one of my customers how to make coffee."

name: Todd Sloane
description: Todd Sloane is a bright and colourful boutique located in Epping and run by Amanda Emery. With a wide range of products on offer, from nursery accessories to bags designed to look like books, this boutique has something for every member of the family. Amanda also runs an in store café which doubles up as a workshop area and hosts a range of craft courses.
founder_quote: "As online retail develops, bricks-and-mortar boutiques are finding ever more creative ways to entice visitors onto the high street and cement themselves as an integral part of their community."

name: Golden Hare Books
description: Golden Hare Books is an independent bookshop located in the heart of Edinburgh and owned by museum curator Mark Jones. Golden Hare is a true advocate of physical books, passionate about the joy that they bring and the creativity of their covers. They work to inspire customers through the unique layout of the shop and the selection of books on offer. To ensure the range reflects the needs of its customers, the team provide personal recommendations for each visitor.
founder_quote: "Whilst online shopping offers speed and efficiency, the experience of visiting a bookshop in person is hard to beat – Trouva does a great job of bridging the gap between the two."

name: Kitchen Provisions
description: Located in Netil Market in London, Kitchen Provisions features a wide range of kitchen necessities curated by experts Helen Symonds and Tom Saunders. They opened their bricks-and-mortar shop to better showcase the products they stock and interact with customers. The pair are passionate about inspiring people to cook and hope their selection of functional and versatile products will do just that.
founder_quote: “We love sourcing unusual yet versatile products for your kitchen: we stock products that you will never have seen before and might never see again.”

name: Little Deer
description: Little Deer is located in Brighton and run by owner Jade Golding who started the business whilst studying photography at university. Originally an online shop, Little Deer was set up as a platform for independent designers. Joined by a small team, Jade has now opened a shop and workshop in Brighton. They stock a range of homeware including their own collection of industrial inspired interior pieces designed and made on-site.
founder_quote: “We are a small, friendly and hardworking team who all know our individual craft inside out, ensuring each and every customer gets a product perfect for them.”

name: Tiosk
description: Located in London’s bustling Broadway Market, Tiosk is a beautiful tea boutique. Featuring an array of loose leaf teas wrapped in stunning packaging, minimalist teaware and kitchen linens, the boutique aims to bring a little luxury to the everyday. With teas ranging from old favourites to re-imagined classics, there’s one to suit every tea-obsessed palate.
founder_quote: "We believe the future of retail is all about the seamless integration of the high street and e-comerce. The ability to; visit a shop, but perhaps purchase from it later on-line, purchase on-line but collect or return goods to the store."

name: Sixty Seven
description: Nestled amongst Brighton’s array of independent boutiques, Sixty Seven is filled with an intriguing array of gifts and homewares which are expertly curated by owner Jo. The team source products from a mix of local artists and popular brands and their collection includes luxury scented candles, stationary and bags. Their eclectic range is designed to inspire and intrigue and the team hope that each customer will leave having discovered the perfect item for them.

name: Pearl and Queenie
description: Located in St Leonards-on-Sea in Sussex, Pearl & Queenie is an exquisite jewellery boutique run by Kathy Dyton. Having helped out in her mother’s shop when she was a child, Kathy has always had a keen interest in independent retail. Featuring Pearl & Queenie’s own range of jewellery alongside collections from other British artisans, the boutique offers both bold designs and refined styles, from statement necklaces to pearl earrings.

name: Yellowstone Art Boutique
description: Located in Stoke-on-Trent, Yellowstone Art Boutique is a colourful showcase of artisanal crafts, curated by owner Hannah Stoney. An artist herself, Hannah opened the store to provide a platform for up and coming artists, designers and makers to show off their wares. Passionate about supporting British design, she takes great care in sharing the stories behind each piece with her customers.
founder_quote: “Looking to the future of retail, I predict a move toward shopping independent. People will buy smaller quantities but higher quality: products that have a story and last a lifetime.”

name: Renne Jewellery
description: Renne Jewellery is based in Richmond in North Yorkshire and is surrounded by the beautiful grounds of Sedbury Hall. Run by mother and daughter duo Helen and Annie Rennison, the boutique offers a stunning range of jewellery, designed in-house and inspired by the pair’s travels. Each piece is designed to be treasured by people of all ages and, as buying jewellery can be a sentimental experience, Helen and Annie work to make each customer’s visit enjoyable and fulfilling.
founder_quote: “We love supporting local, independent retailers: many boutique founders have amazingly creative personalities and we love shopping their unique edits.”

name: Dotty Home
description: Based in the seaside town of Sidmouth in Devon, Dotty Home presents a sophisticated edit of homewares. The collection is inspired by a range of styles including Scandinavian, French Vintage and Country Cottage, creating an eclectic range of products for customers to enjoy. The team source their collection from across England and Europe and pride themselves in the efficiency and quality of their customer service.

name: The English Listed
description: Located in St Ives just outside Cambridge, The English Listed is run by husband and wife duo Frazer Stannard and Tolly Nason who are passionate about timeless design and the renovation of period buildings. Combining their experience in building, glass art and interior design, the pair curate a beautiful edit of understated homeware products, many of which are crafted from natural materials.
founder_quote: “We feel provenance and originality will become increasingly important for shoppers in the coming years and with that, independent shops will offer multi-sensory in store experiences and outstanding customer service.”

name: Greens
description: Located in Sunningdale, Greens offers a selection of high quality apparel for the modern gentleman. Sourcing products from premium brands including Neil Barrett, Nudie Jeans and John Varvatos, the team expertly curate a collection of the latest designs and trends. They are passionate about finding the right product for each customer and have become a go-to destination for the style-savvy man.

name: Peponita
description: Located on London’s vibrant Columbia Road, Peponita features shoes and accessories designed and sourced by owner Sigrid. Frustrated with the lack of stylish, comfortable shoes on the market, Sigrid started designing her own range, combining contemporary styles with quality manufacturing. Sigrid has since expanded the business and the boutique now includes shoes designed by a range of entrepreneurial women. All products are designed and handmade across Europe and London.
founder_quote: “Peponita is on Columbia Road which has the famous Sunday flower market so there is always a lovely buzzing atmosphere.”

name: Hoos
description: Glasgow-based Hoos is run by Karen Harvey and offers a delightful array of homewares inspired by Scandinavian design. After a successful career in the third sector, receiving an MBE for the work of her charity in Norfolk, Karen returned to her home town to open Hoos. With a keen interest in design, she curates timeless products for the contemporary home and draws inspiration from Glasgow’s rich art and design heritage.
founder_quote: "A growing number of people are supporting the independent boutiques in their neighbourhood; shops where they can purchase distinctive products and brands that they can’t find elsewhere on the high-street."

name: Vintage Bay
description: Vintage Bay is located in the lively town of Hitchin and is run by founder Amy, who draws inspiration from Alpine and rustic styling. With a passion for vintage and eclectic items, Amy scours the globe to source products for her boutique, providing customers with a unique range to browse through. After running a mobile café from a converted Piaggio Ape, Amy was inspired to open up her own shop and set about drawing up a business plan for Vintage Bay.
founder_quote: “With support, independents will thrive: shoppers love buying from hard working, independent retailers who can offer expert advice and beautiful products, a trend which looks set to continue."

name: Maya Magal
description: Located in Islington in London, Maya Magal is a specialist jewellery boutique featuring timeless pieces for women. Maya’s grandfather introduced her to gemology and jewellery-making as a child and she has since been captivated by the craft. Inspired by street style, her collections are characterised by tailored and geometric designs. Creating strong, personal relationships with customers is a key focus and Maya provides each with a luxury retail experience.
founder_quote: “I believe that online platforms create an amazing opportunity for shops to communicate and connect with their customers, enabling them to learn more about the people who support them.”

name: Karabo
description: Situated in the quaint town of Leamington Spa, Karabo presents a premium edit of denim curated by Stephanie Lambdon and her team. Offering jeans in all shapes and shades, from skinny to bootcut, the team take delight in uncovering the perfect pair for each customer. Alongside the extensive range of denim, customers can discover a collection of tops, accessories and lifestyle products and the relaxed atmosphere invites them to browse with ease.

name: From Victoria
description: Packed full of bohemian homewares and botanicals, From Victoria is located in Lewes in East Sussex and is run by Victoria Turner. With a passion for nature, Victoria curates an edit of calming homewares and accessories which are crafted from natural materials such as palm and bamboo.

name: Paper Parade Stationers
description: Located in Edinburgh, Paper Parade Stationers offers an array of colourful cards and stationery and is run by creative duo Rachael Sommerville and Cara Holsgrove. The pair met whilst studying illustration at Edinburgh College of Art and discovered a joint passion for design. The boutique is a showcase of their talent, featuring a wide range of greetings cards designed in-house alongside other stationery items.
founder_quote: "Looking to the future of retail, we see people moving away from the pile 'em high, sell 'em cheap mentality, preferring richer and more rewarding experiences when shopping, both online and in person."

name: Sparks Yard
description: Spanning three floors of a Grade II listed Victorian warehouse, Spark's Yard was originally founded by owner Holly in 2004 as a space to sell the distinctive homewares she found on her travels. Since then the business has blossomed, and has grown to include a coffee bar, restaurant, and cook shop filled with kitchen gifts and gadgets.
founder_quote: We believe that in this current climate, the retailer must go the extra mile for the customer - standing out from the crowd, selling a lifestyle and offering an outstanding bespoke service.

name: Marram Trading
description: Located in the vibrant village of Hurstpierpoint in West Sussex, Marram Trading was founded by Millie Hampson. Inspired by the courage of independent British retailers, Millie opened the boutique in 2015, offering the local community a range of beautiful lifestyle products and a welcoming coffee house. She invites customers to browse with ease, her retail space designed to encourage them to relax and interact with each other and the array of quality products on offer.
founder_quote: "Independent stores can really thrive on our high streets by offering an excellent shopping experience where customers can pick up quirky one off gifts - something that is not offered by the large chains."

name: Ruby & Willow
description: Stocking an array of popular kid’s brands, Ruby & Willow is located in Leigh-on-Sea and is run by Nicky Wood & Claire Harvey. The pair opened the boutique after uncovering a gap in the market for affordable yet stylish kidswear. They expertly curate an edit of clothing and accessories for little ones, from t-shirts to dresses and mix-and-match items which they source from a selection of small brands. The collection offers a showcase of bold prints, quality materials and contemporary designs.
founder_quote: "Looking to the future of retail, we believe that whilst online retail will continue to grow over the coming years, customers will always love visiting physical shops to discover amazing products in person."

name: Wick Candle Boutique
description: A uniquely edited collection of scents for the home, Wick Candle Boutique is located in Hove and was founded by Anna and Roxanna in 2015. The pair were inspired by the creativity of the people and brands they now work with; collaborative makers who introduce botany, floristry, art, travel, music and other elements into their fragrance work, creating new and distinctive products. The concept of the boutique is to bring a host of different scent forms and styles under one roof.

name: épanoui
description: Located in Bedford, épanoui was founded by owner Hannah in 2015 with the aim of showcasing products that would inspire shoppers to feel good in their own skin. From this came the name "épanoui" - the word itself means to blossom or flourish, which perfectly epitomises the positive energy and aspirations behind the boutique.
founder_quote: It feels like nowadays discerning shoppers are really hunting out a considered retail experience. This gives me confidence that we will continue to see a rise in support for independent retailers and new and exciting wave of shops opening.

name: Whitespace Kids
description: Set up by childhood best friends Carla Cavani and Mairi Coia, Whitespace Kids is a children’s concept boutique located in the heart of Glasgow. With a passion for inspiring young minds, the pair source a colourful array of modern toys and accessories for all children of all ages. Their collection features timeless designs and quality materials and includes popular brands such as Petit Monkey, Done by Deer and Hape.

name: Truffle Clothing
description: Run by Hayley Clarke and Arabella Brown and located in Ipswich, Truffle Clothing features contemporary womenswear and accessories. Offering a comfortable and inspiring retail space, the boutique encourages a relaxing shopping experience, where customers can browse a range of brands and styles with varied price points. By curating a wide product selection, the team can reach a large market whilst retaining the feeling of exclusivity.
founder_quote: "Able to offer a more fulfilling customer experience than larger retail outlets, I predict that independent boutiques will thrive in the coming years, leading to a revival of our high streets."

name: bcharmd
description: A chic shop in the heart of Newcastle Upon Tyne, Bcharmd stocks an elegant range of jewellery and is run by Stephanie Milburn. Designing each piece herself, Stephanie launches a new collection every season, keeping her range fresh and exciting. Her boutique offers a luxury environment, where customers can uncover affordable pieces and receive one-to-one advice from Stephanie and her knowledgeable team.
founder_quote: "I think that independent boutiques will become more and more sought after as the discerning customer insists on better service and more unusual products."

name: Green Gate
description: Located in Arundel on the south coast, Green Gate offers an unrivalled selection of heath supplements created by founder Innessa Bauer. Through years of travelling the world and interacting with individuals from all walks of life Innessa discovered the power of healthy eating and clean food. She has since opened the doors at Green Gate and, through her collection of luxury superfoods, she hopes to encourage wellness and good health and promote the importance of replenishing, nourishing and taking care of the body.
founder_quote: “Throughout my travels, I have experienced the power of clean food. Eating a healthy diet has always been a major part of my life and, through Green Gate, I wish to share my passion with others.”

name: Soper & Co
description: Founded by Matt and Amy, Soper & Co has been a labour of love since its early days. What started from humble beginnings in Matt's dad's workshop is now a fully-fledged boutique on Toddington High Street (complete with a workshop where Matt builds bespoke furniture). Throughout these changes, the philosophy behind the boutique has always stayed the same - to offer thoughtful, well-made products that customers will love.
founder_quote: We think the nation is slowly coming around to shopping more independent. As an independent we pride ourselves in going that extra mile and providing our customers with the service they deserve.

name: Colony
description: Located in Totnes in Devon, a town filled with independent retailers, Colony offers a showcase of contemporary womensware curated by owner Claire Shaw. Spotting a gap in the market for stylish yet affordable apparel, Claire opened the boutique in 2014 much to the delight of locals who visit the town for its diverse and cultural offerings. She has grown her edit over the years to include a variety of brands and styles which can be integrated into an existing wardrobe.
founder_quote: "I am extremely excited to witness the evolution of independent retail: the people behind the brand are more prevalent now than ever and I believe shoppers are appreciating this new localised ethos and are changing their habits."

name: Ismad London
description: Brixton-based boutique Ismad was founded by Isabelle Martial and offers a unique edit of leather bags designed and made in-house. Isabelle fell in love with handcrafted leather goods whilst travelling, in awe of the craftsmanship involved in their creation. Beginning as a small market stall in Camden Town, Ismad has since moved into a larger workshop space in Brixton where a team of artisans work on the designs.
founder_quote: "We love working in the boutique each day; the space has an old school feel to it and we always enjoy sharing our story with customers."

name: Camperdown Lane
description: Camperdown Lane is an independent homewares and interiors shop located in Hereford and run by sisters Michelle Nugent, Sarah Nugent and Kate Hollingsworth. The shop offers an inspirational space in which customers can find beautiful and practical interior accessories, homewares and gifts. They source their products from both small designers and leading manufacturers and aim to help each customer find products to make their home stylish and comfortable.
founder_quote: "We believe that it is our responsibility as retailers to create a place that is enticing and desirable for customers to visit. It is not enough to sit back and expect people to come, we have to offer them something more."

name: Biscuit
description: Nestled between independent shops in the heart of Edinburgh, Biscuit presents an edit of apparel and lifestyle products, curated by owner Amanda Mitchell. Moving to Edinburgh from London, Amanda wanted to provide the local community with a beautiful and welcoming retail environment filled with inspiring products. After an incredibly successful first year, Biscuit won the Drapers Best Newcomer Independent Award, prompting Amanda to open a second boutique in the city.
founder_quote: “I believe that whilst people will always buy online for convenience, they will continue to love shopping in bricks-and-mortar shops, embracing the opportunity to see products in a beautifully thought out environment.”

name: Brand Academy Store
description: Located in the iconic OXO Tower in London, Brand Academy Store is a showcase of the best interior brands and design talent from around the world. Sourcing a diverse collection of products from brands including Joseph and Joseph, Kikkerland and Black + Blum, the boutique is a go-to for distinctive home accessories.
founder_quote: "I think that people are going to become more discerning about what and where they’re buying, shopping more responsibly and placing a higher value on the customer experience in the environment."

name: SMUG
description: Nestled among a host of independent shops on Camden passage in Islington, SMUG is filled with an edit of homewares curated by owner Lizzie Evans. Lizzie's vision for SMUG has always been for it to feel like a home: products are curated within the space to bring the customer a beautifully styled, design-led collection of products within a home-like setting. Alongside the retail space, the shop also has an in-store café and the team run a programme of workshops to allow customers to interact with the space in a relaxed setting.
founder_quote: "In the future, we hope to offer more than our hand-picked and curated collection of products, we hope to work with other like-minded independent boutique owners to create a community of creative entrepreneurs."

name: Eteaket
description: Eteaket is an innovative tea boutique, located in Edinburgh and founded by Erica Moore.  The boutique offers a showcase of loose leaf tea and brewing equipment, allowing customers to gain more of an insight into the team’s processes and sample the various ranges. To further inspire customers, the boutique hosts various events including tea cocktail masterclasses, tea and chocolate tastings and launch nights for new ranges.
founder_quote: “With Eteaket, we are inspired to modernise the British tea culture with the highest quality loose leaf tea and innovative products for our customers to share and enjoy.”

name: Goods.
description: Lewes-based Goods is filled with a cheerful array of products, curated by Catherine and Jake who source their products from brands based across the world. Inspired by bad ass babe creatives, the pair have a keen eye for products which make you smile plus anything with a 70s vibe. They also have an interest in modern culture and are currently exploring the concept of clean beauty, sourcing a lot of beauty brands from LA. They love sharing their excitement for new products with customers and hope to find the perfect item for everyone who visits
founder_quote: 'We fill the shop with the things that we buy for our home, whether that's treasures from our travels, cult products that we've seen on Instagram, or just things that make us smile.'

name: Persora
description: Located in Pershore in Worcestershire, Persora is a charming home and lifestyle boutique run by Cheryl, Tony and their daughters Sasha and Aimee. The team source an array of accessories for the home including soft furnishings, lighting and kitchenware and their collection includes a mix of contemporary and retro items. The team also runs an art gallery, which is situated next to the retail space.

founder_quote: We work with some of the most exciting artists on unique and unusual products for you, for your home, or for a unique gift.
description:
Beach London is a gallery and creative agency in Tottenham.

We stock unique and unusual artists editions, clothing, homeware, and more that you won't find anywhere else!
name: Beach London
Floris London
description: Founded in 1730 by Juan Famenias Floris and his wife Elizabeth, Floris is located at 89 Jermyn Street, St. James’ in London, which is the original shop, and continues to be run by the family. The team maintain a dedication to traditional techniques and create their distinguished fragrances in the in-house perfumery. Alongside their most time-honoured scents, the team continue to develop and expand their range, developing fragrances which correspond with defining moments in British history such as the Queen’s Diamond Jubilee.

name: CALF
description: Based in Knaresborough in North Yorkshire, CALF, which stands for Caring About Living Fairly, is a womenswear boutique showcasing ethically produced fashion. The team only source products which have been made responsibly, both in the materials from which they are crafted and the working conditions in which they were manufactured. They source collections from a range of contemporary brands and each piece is beautifully designed and made to last.

name: The Voewood
description: Having spent her formative years playing in her parents' shop in Durham, it was a natural choice for Nicola Hibon Jackson to work in retail. Her boutique The Voewood is a laid-back lifestyle destination in London's Blackheath Standard where shoppers can find unusual jewellery, clothing, and homewares that reflect their personal style. Visit the shop and you may well find Nicola's own two children playing there, carrying on the family tradition.
founder_quote: One of the key aims of our shop is to offer beautiful things to wear, to use and to enjoy in an informal, family-friendly environment.

name: Goodordering
description: Located in Hackney, Goodordering Store is filled with a nostalgic range of bags and accessories, designed by owner Jacqui Ma. Incorporating the values of family get-togethers and those captured moments of happiness, Goodordering offers a colourful array of bags inspired by Japanese school bags and 80s retro travel bags. The boutique allows the team to share their story with customers and enables customers to interact with the products in person. Whilst in the shop, customers can personalise their bags with patches, read magazines and even get their hair cut!
founder_quote: “Even though online retail will continue to be a convenient way of shopping, real life is about getting out there, talking to people, moving, chance encounters and pushing our lives beyond the screen.”

name: Kagu Interiors
description: Located in Tenterden in Kent, KAGU Interiors is a design led boutique stocking items which have been sourced from all over the globe, from English skincare to Indian chopping boards. Having originally opened the shop to showcase his own hand-crafted range of furniture, Ben now works with a number of brands and designers. His carefully curated collection includes ceramics, soft furnishings and lanterns in a range of earthy tones.
founder_quote: "Since opening KAGU, I have found a wealth of suppliers who have kindly let me showcase their items within my shop. I love working alongside other inspirational makers and curating the collection in an exciting way for customers."

name: No50
description: Located in the bustling city of Birmingham, No50 was founded by brothers Jamie and Jordan Quinn who combine quality and style in their curated edit of apparel and accessories. Sourcing products from heritage and lifestyle brands including Hunter, Poler Outdoor Stuff and Herschel Supply Co., the pair draw on past retail experience to provide a bespoke shopping experience for customers.

name: Home By Tea
description: Located in the Nottinghamshire town of Southwell, Home By Tea offers modern homewares for the contemporary interior. Running an interior design service alongside the retail space, the team are experts in all things design and enjoy nothing better than helping and advising customers to find the perfect product for their home. Discover everything from lighting to kitchenware and nursery décor – a one stop shop for homewares.

name: Accessories for the Home
description: Located in Walkden, just outside Manchester, Accessories for the Home offers a showcase of homewares curated by owner Samantha. After starting a family, Samantha decided to open her own homewares shop, following in the footsteps of her parents. Her passion for homewares is evident in her elegantly curated selection, filled with vintage and industrial pieces.
